loans.use: to buy supplies for her restaurant.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her university studies and to buy school supplies like books.

loans.name: Gautami

texts.en:
Gautami hails from Maynaguri and is a rural young woman of only 29 years.  She lives with her husband Niranjan and their two sons in the small village of Tekatuli in Jalpaiguri district.  In her childhood, she did not get the opportunity for education.  She is illiterate and can only sign her name.  Her husband has an education until grade nine.  Both of their sons attend school and they are in different grades in secondary school.

Gautami is a homemaker and her husband is engaged in cultivation of tea plant.  Over these years of tireless work, he has been able to get success in his business, which is profitable enough to cover household expenses. Gautami plans to expand the family's agribusiness by making some investments.  They want to grow more tea plants.  Since Jalpaiguri is a district where the soil and climate are perfectly suitable for tea plantation, they have chosen cultivation of tea plants.  They are in need of financial support.

Gautami applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to purchase tea saplings, fertilizers and other necessary materials to start cultivation. She hopes to earn a good profit from this new business through this loan.  Her first priority is her children's education.  So she wants to provide them with better education as well as good food and health.

She conveys her thanks to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase tea saplings and fertilizers to grow tea plants.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, tomato paste, cereal, and soda.

loans.name: Luisa Maribel

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito 24 de mayo,  este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Luisa, tiene 53 años de edad, está divorciada pero  de esa relación tiene cuatro hijos mayores de edad uno de ellos aun viven con ella.
Doña Luisa es una mujer que siempre le ha gustado ganarse lo suyo para salir adelante, ella sola y con su esfuerzo saco adelante a sus hijos, ella  se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos carteras y  productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, realiza sus recorridos  todos los días ya que así se entretiene visitando sus clientes aunque también vende en su casa, deja a crédito y cobra cada semana.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos, carteras, perfumes, cremas y cosméticos. Ella está desde  el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito le gusta por la puntualidad de los créditos. Sus sueños son seguir adelante y tener buena salud.
texts.en:
Every fifteen days in the city of Tosagua, the credit group "24th of May" meets. This region is known for being a dynamic place where most people are farmers or ranchers, and for being a very green area.

This is where Luisa, age 53, lives. She is divorced, but she has four grown children from her marriage that still live with her. Luisa is a woman who's always liked to make her own way. Through her own efforts, she raised her children to get ahead. She's in the business of selling clothing, shoes, wallets, and Yanbal products (including beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women's accessories). She sells door to door, going out and making her rounds every day and inviting clients into her home as well. They buy on credit and she collects every week.

This loan is to buy clothing, shoes, wallets, creams and cosmetics. She's been in the credit group from the start, and what she likes is the timeliness of the loans. Her dreams include getting ahead in life and staying healthy.

loans.use: buy clothing, shoes, and beauty products for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more slippers to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy different  auto spare parts and batteries to increase the business in his store.

loans.name: Ajma

texts.en:
Ajma is a very young and active woman of only 19 years.  She is married and a mother of a toddler.  She was married at a very tender age so she could not receive a higher education.  She has a secondary education. She is married to Muzaffar, who is a very young entrepreneur.  He studied until grade eight.  Due to the lack of finances, he had to give up his education and was compelled to do some work in order to earn for the family.

Ajma’s husband has a small bakery adjacent to their house where he bakes loaves, biscuits, cakes etc.and supplies them to the local stationary shops.  He has laborers and Ajma helps her husband in his job after finishing her household work. He is a humble and hardworking man.  But most of his income is spent to pay the wages of his laborers and to purchase ingredients, as the prices are going higher day by day. So he needs to expand his business for a steady income.  Financial help will be very helpful for this.

In order to fulfill her husband’s dream, Ajma took a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to purchase ingredients like flour, eggs, salt, sugar, oil etc. and other equipment.  She hopes this loan will help them to reach their goals of giving a better living standard to their family and to save money to purchase an auto-rickshaw for another means of income.

She and her husband are very much grateful to her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for her husband's existing bakery.

loans.name: Yohana Elizabeth

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito 24 de mayo,  este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Yohana, tiene 26 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de 6  años que estudia en escuela. El marido trabaja en una farmacia. 
Doña Yohana es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, zapatos y otros productos de catalogo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella  recorre la ciudad ofreciendo sus productos y también vende en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando necesitan de alguna prenda, deja a crédito y cobra cada semana, lleva más de 2 años en esta actividad y le va muy bien.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos y cosméticos. Lleva más de 5 ciclos  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten financiar su negocio. Sus sueños son tener un local.
texts.en:
The loan group "24th of May" meets every two weeks in the city of Tosagua. This place is known for being very dynamic. The majority of its inhabitants work in agriculture and raising animals, since it is an area with a lot of vegetation.

Señora Yohana lives in this place. She is 26 years old and is in a free union relationship from which she has a 6-year-old son who is in school. Her husband works in a drugstore.

Doña Yohana is housewife who, in order to obtain her own resources and with them to help her husband with the household expenses, sells clothing of all types, shoes, and other catalog products. Her form of sales is door to door. She goes through the city offering her products, and she also sells from her house, where her customers arrive when they need some item. She sells on credit and collects every week. She has been in this business for more than 2 years, and it is going very well for her.

This loan is to buy clothing, shoes, and cosmetics. She has been in the loan group for more than 5 loan cycles, and she likes it because the loans allow her to finance her business. Her dreams are to have a shop.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Wahid

texts.en: Meet Wahid. He is a hardworking and optimistic man who runs a small stall that sells snacks, drinks, and mobile airtime credits. Wahid and his wife run the business together to meet the family's needs. They live in Serang, a semi-urban area located about two hours from Jakarta. Wahid began working with Ruma five months ago because he wanted to increase his family's income. Other than that, he is also interested in mobile technology. As a Ruma agent, Wahid has been performing very well; his daily transactions from mobile airtime credits can be up to 75-150 per day and are expected to grow more. As the business runs, he needs a working capital loan from Kiva to process more transactions. In the future, Wahid is planning to seek more business opportunities. In the photo, Wahid is standing in front of his stall.

loans.use: To process more mobile airtime credits sales on the weekends

loans.name: María Teresa

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito 24 de mayo,  este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 58 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos mayores  de edad, dos de ellos aun viven en su casa. El marido es comerciante. 
Doña María junto a su marido  tienen en el centro de la ciudad  una pequeña fábrica de chifles, todos los días desde la madrugada ellos se desplazan hasta este lugar a fabricar este producto el cual que una vez que está listo lo empacan en fundas para luego venderlas a los clientes que a diario llegan hasta su local a comprar este delicioso producto, su esposo  también entregar en ciertos comedores de la ciudad que son clientes desde hace varios años, llevan más de 30 años con este negocio con el cual han sacado adelante a su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar plátano, aceite, sal y fundas  para la fabricación de los chifles. Lleva 12 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la  ayuda para salir adelante. Sus sueños son tener un local propio.
texts.en:
Every fifteen days in the city of Tosagua, the credit group "24th of May" meets. This region is known for being a dynamic place where most people are farmers or ranchers, and for being a very green area.

This is where María, age 58, lives. She's married, and she and her husband have four grown children, two of whom still live at home.  María and her husband have a tiny factory in the middle of town where they make chifles, or fried plantain chips. They get up at dawn every day to go to the factory to make the chips. Once ready, they pack them and sell them to the customers that arrive to buy the delicious snack. Her husband also delivers them to various diners around town who have been clients for years. They have more than thirty years of experience in this work and it's been how they've gotten their family ahead.

This loan will be used to buy plantain, oil, salt, and sacks to make chifles. They've been in the credit group for twelve years and they like the help that it's provided them over the years. They dream of having their own sales location one day.

loans.use: buy ingredients needed to make and sell fried plantain chips

loans.name: Lucia Leonor

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito 24 de mayo,  este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Lucia, tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de  13 y 9 años que estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo se dedica al comercio.
Doña Lucia junto a su marido  tienen un local en el cual se dedican a la venta de bicicletas y todo tipo de repuestos, llantas y accesorios para las mismas,  trabajan todos los días, el también realiza trabajos de ensamblado y reparaciones de las bicicletas, son más de 10 años que realizan esta labor con la cual sacan adelante a su familia.
Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar bicicletas, llantas y todo tipo de  repuestos  y accesorios para bicicletas. Lleva más de 5 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque así ella puede ayudarle a su marido. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Every fifteen days in the city of Tosagua, the credit group "24th of May" meets. This region is known for being a dynamic place where most people are farmers or ranchers, and for being a very green area.

This is where Lucia, age 35, lives. She's married and has two children, age 13 and 9, who are both in school. Lucia and her husband have a shop where they sell bicycles and all sorts of parts, tires, and accessories for bikes as well. Her husband also assembles and repairs bikes. They work every day and have been in the business for more than ten years. It's how they have gotten their family ahead.

This loan will be used to buy bicycles, tires, spare parts, and various bike accessories. Lucia's been in the credit group for five years, and she likes it because it means she's been able to help her husband. Her dream is to provide her sons with the best.

loans.use: buy bikes, tires, spare parts, and bike accessories for resale

loans.name: Alema

texts.en:
Alema is only 25 years old and has a primary education but she is a hard working lady. Her husband Tajimul is 28 years old and is involved in agriculture. They lead a very hard life. She lives with her husband and sons in the small village of Bagnan in Jalpaiguri district.

The income from Alema's husband's agribusiness is too scant to cover all the necessary expenses of their family. So for the last few years, Alema has been helping her husband by breeding livestock. She started her business by purchasing one dairy cow.  She supplies milk to her neighbors, who are her main clients.  Now she has become a very strong financial support for the family. In order to give her family a better lifestyle, she intends to expand her business. She wants to increase her buyers, so she needs one more cow. Thus, she will be able to get more milk. So she applied for a loan from Kiva's partner BJS.

With the loan, she wants to purchase a cow to expand her own business and to give financial support to her husband. She wants to sell the milk at the market to earn money and to give financial assistance to her family. In the future, she wants to buy more cows and extend this business.

Maybe Alema would have had to fight her battle alone if BJS and Kiva had not come her way and hold her hand tightly. It was a fine morning when she met one of the field staff from BJS, came to know about BJS' activities and decided to take a loan. BJS stands beside her to fight against poverty, so she is very much obliged that BJS and Kiva came into her life as a light of success.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for her existing dairy business.

loans.name: Rosa Adelaida

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito 24 de mayo,  este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 68 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos mayores  de edad, ella tiene una niña de crianza que tiene 13 años,  estudia en colegio y la cual es su compañía ahora que sus hijos ya están grandes. El marido es artesano.
Doña Rosa es una mujer que le gusta salir adelante y con su esfuerzo  ayudar a pagar  los gastos que genera el hogar, ella tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres en su casa, allí vende todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad, granos, legumbres, plátano y ciertas bebidas, le encanta su negocio ya que allí ella se gana algo que les sirve para salir adelante ya que su marido no gana mucho en sus actividades, lleva más de 14  años con su tienda la cual empezó con el primer crédito que recibió del grupo por lo cual está muy agradecida.
Este crédito es para comprar víveres para surtir su tienda. Lleva 14 años en el grupo de crédito y le gusta porque así empezó su negocio. Su sueño es tener una tienda más grande y surtida.
texts.en:
Every fifteen days in the city of Tosagua, the credit group "24th of May" meets. This region is known for being a dynamic place where most people are farmers or ranchers, and for being a very green area.

This is where Rosa, age 68, lives. She is married, and they have four grown children. She is also caring for a 13-year-old girl who is in high school and is her companion now that her children are grown up. Her husband is a craftsman.

Rosa is a woman who likes to come out on top, and her hard work helps pay the household expenses. She has a small grocery store that she runs out of her home where she sells all kinds of high necessity items, such as grains, dried beans, plantains, and some beverages. She loves her business since that's where she earns enough to maintain the household; her husband doesn't earn a lot in his work. She has fourteen years of experience with her store, which she gratefully started with her first loan from the credit group.

This loan will be used to buy groceries to stock her store. She's been in the credit group for 14 years and she likes it because it's how she was able to start her business. He dream is to have a larger, better stocked store.

loans.use: stock her grocery store

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita hails from a lower-middle class family and lives in the remote village of Tekatuli in the district of Jalpaiguri with her husband Gourango and two children (one son and one daughter). She is 39 years old and a homemaker.  She studied until grade seven, but could not continue due to her parental poverty.  Both of children attend school and are in grade seven and grade nine.

Her husband is associated with a business selling paddy. He purchases paddy in bulk from the wholesale market and sells it in their neighborhood and in the local village grocery shops. Being the staple food for the regional people, the crop is in great demand in the market.  He works tirelessly to grow his business. Anita helps him in his work.  He sells quality crops at reasonable prices.  So the number of his customers is increasing rapidly.  Now to satisfy them, he wants to grow his business by buying more paddy from the wholesale market.

So, Anita has asked for a loan from BJS to purchase good quality paddy to help her husband to carry on more production.  The increased income from their business will help her to redefine their family's future by building their livelihood.  Her goal is to provide a higher education for her children, which she hopes to fulfill through this financial help.

loans.use: To purchase paddy in bulk for their business

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es:
El socio Wilson se dedica al negocio de agencia de viajes,el socio trabaja con personas extranjeras y nacionales, el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,el socio ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de agencia de viajes.El socio solicita el crédito para comprar boletos turísticos.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Communal bank member Wilson works in a travel agency business. He works with foreigners and nationals. He works from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm. He has been in this business for a number of years, and it is going very well for him. His dream is to expand his travel agency business. He is applying for the loan to purchase tourist tickets.

He is happy about the loan and promises to make his payments.

loans.use: to buy tourist tickets.

loans.name: Anjali

texts.en:
Aanjali is a strong woman who stands tall in the face of adversity.  She is a very young woman from Maynaguri.  Her family is comprised of her husband and two young children.  They live in the small village of Bagnan in Jalpaiguri district.  She received an education until grade 10 and did not have the opportunity to go for further study.  She is married to Amalendu, a 39-year-old farmer.

After her marriage, she started taking care of the household chores, while her husband used to work in agriculture. He was the main breadwinner for the family and used to grow seasonable vegetables.  But as his income was far behind to give financial sustenance to his family, Anjali started a dairy business to earn additional income.  She is now the owner of one dairy cow.  She sells cow milk to her neighbors. Now, she has become the main source of income for the family. She wants to expand her business by purchasing one more cow.

With this aim, she is seeking a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner).  She will use the loan to purchase one more dairy cow, which will provide her with more milk to sell.  She hopes the earnings from the business will give her family financial sustenance to lead a smooth life.

She intends to purchase more cows to expand her cattle herd.

She gives her thanks to both BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for her milk-selling business.

loans.name: Anra

texts.en:
Anra is a rural woman of 45 years from Maynaguri. She is married to Ramjan. Together they are raising one son and one daughter who are students and both read in grade nine. Anna has a primary education and her husband studied until grade nine. They live in Khagrabari, a remote village in Jalpaiguri district, in their own house.

Anra's husband has been successfully operating a grocery store for a few years.  He sells rice, pulses, flour, salt, sugar, biscuits, spices, etc. The shop is adjacent to their house. Anra, who is a homemaker, helps with her husband's work after finishing her household jobs. The business has provided good financial support for their family for so long. Now, the demands of the customers are increasing, and he can't fulfill their demands due to a lack of money. He needs financial help so he can stock his shop with a variety of products. At the same time, the increased sales will provide them with better revenue.

Anra asked for a business loan from BJS to make bulk purchases of groceries at a low cost from wholesalers so that she can make higher sales. She hopes to earn profit, which will help her to achieve her targets of better providing for her family, giving proper education to her children and making her shop bigger with more grocery items.

Anra thanks her generous lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items for their grocery shop.

loans.name: Suomo Group

texts.en:
These three members, part of the group called Soumo (Love), live in the same town and the same area. They sell jeans, electrical gadgets and cement.

The group representative, Georgina (the female in the photo), is 31 years old and married to Joseph, a block seller. The couple lives with their five children, all in school. Georgina attended school to elementary level. The couple provides for the household together. 

For close to two years, Georgina has sold cement in a kiosk at her home. She gets her supplies at a city in Ghana. This is the third time Georgina and the other members of the lending group are seeking financial support from ID-Ghana with the goal of diversifying their businesses and better responding to the needs of their clients. The previous loan were repaid properly.

loans.use: to buy more cement to sell to customers.

loans.name: Rosa Italia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito 24 de mayo,  este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 69 años de edad, está separada pero de esa  relación tienen cinco hijos mayores  de edad, uno de ellos aun vive con ella.
Doña es una mujer que siempre le ha gustado trabajar y con sus esfuerzo salir adelante ella y sus hijos después que se separo del marido, ella   tiene un local en su casa donde vende bicicletas de todo tipo, además en su local sus clientes pueden encontrar llantas y todo tipo de repuestos y accesorios para bicicletas,  con ella trabaja uno de sus hijos el cual es el que se encarga de ensamblar las bicicletas y darles asesoramiento a sus clientes, son más de 20 años que llevan con este negocio con el cual ella pudo sacar adelante a sus hijos.
Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar bicicletas, llantas y todo tipo de  repuestos  y accesorios para bicicletas. Lleva más de 11 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos ella financia su negocio. Sus sueños son tener buena salud y seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The loan group "24th of May" meets every two weeks in the city of Tosagua. This place is known for being very dynamic. The majority of its inhabitants work in agriculture and animal raising, because it is a zone with a lot of vegetation.

Señora Rosa lives in this place. She is 69 years old. She is separated but has five adult children from this relationship. One of them still lives with her.

Doña Rosa is a woman who has always liked to work and through her effort to get ahead with her children after she separated from her husband. She has a shop in her home where she sells bicycles of all types. In addition, her customers can find tires and all types of spare parts and accessories for bicycles in her shop. One of her sons works with her, and he is in charge of assembling the bicycles and giving advice to the customers. They have had this business for more than 20 years, and with it she was able to raise her children.

She is going to use this loan to buy bicycles, tires, and all types of spare parts and accessories for bicycles. She has been in the loan group for more than 11 years, and she likes it because she finances her business with the loans. Her dreams are to have good health and continue advancing.

loans.use: to buy bicycles, tires, spare parts, and accessories for bicycles.

loans.name: Remalyn

texts.en: For the past two years, Remalyn has offered tangi and milk fish within her village. She is married to a fisherman and blessed with two children. Her eldest has settled for marriage and her other child is working. Remalyn wants to increase the kilograms of milk fish (boneless and fresh) and tangi fish she offers but she struggles for shortage of capital. She is seeking a loan of PHP 17,000. She hopes to avail this amount of loan to earn a greater income and to be able to supply all her customers' demands.

loans.use: to buy boneless milk fish, tangi fish and fresh milk fish to sell

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La socia Hilda  se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de ropa y vanta de productos de belleza, la socia vende pantalones, blusas y polos, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un bazar. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar zapatos, polos, chompas, polos y blusas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Communal bank member Hilda continues working in her business of selling clothing and selling beauty products. She sells pants, blouses, and polo shirts. She has already been in this business for a number of years, and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to have a bazaar. She is applying for the loan to buy shoes, polo shirts, sweaters, and blouses.

She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy shoes, polo shirts, sweaters, and blouses

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is a 37-year-old married lady who is blessed with three children.

She is a woman of many trades as she has three different businesses running concurrently. Specifically, she operates a mobile money transfer business, a gas-sales and -filling shop, and a kerosene pump where she sells kerosene to customers in small quantities.

She is now applying for her second loan, which she plans to use by adding capital to her mobile money transfer business and by refiling some gas cylinders for re-sale. She anticipates earning more profits as a result of the loan, which she would save towards the education of her children. In future she would love to own a gas-filling station and to be able to educate her children to the highest level possible.

loans.use: to better capitalize her money transfer business and to refill additional gas cylinders

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Kanika

texts.en:
Kanika is 43 years old and married.  She is from Maynaguri.  She lives with her husband at Tekatuli, a remote village in the district of Jalpaiguri.  They have no children.  Both are illiterate because their parents had poor economic resources.

Kanika and her husband are not officially employed because of their illiteracy. Moreover, it is difficult to find work in the village. That is why her husband Chitta is involved in agricultural work. But the income from this business can hardly cover their necessary expenses. Kanika rears cattle for additional income for the family. For the last two years, she has been engaged in these activities.  She is a hardworking, active and ambitious woman who wants to get ahead in life.  She works hard all day long, does her household jobs and looks after her cattle.  She has a dairy cow. She sells milk in her locality.  Now to cope with the growing expenses of her family, she needs financial support to improve her business by purchasing one more cow.

So, she is requesting a loan from BJS to purchase a cow and fodder. She hopes through this loan, she will make her business bigger and earn more to give her family economic stability.  

She is thankful to both BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for her existing milk supply business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional inventory (e.g., plastic bowls and buckets) for re-sale.

loans.name: Al Aataa 3 Group

texts.en:
Hanine is the featured borrower of Al Aataa 3 group. She gets along well with the other group members, who are all seeking to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua. The group members have always been neighbors and friends, and they all seek to improve their standards of living.

Hanine is a 25-year-old single lady who works hard to earn a living, especially since she is seeking the best education possible at the same time. That is, Hanine has worked in the training domain for a year now, but she earns a limited monthly salary that does not cover her ever-increasing university tuition fees.

As a result, she is seeking this loan to pay for her university tuition fees. She is looking forward to graduating and starting her own career. In the meantime, she is concentrating on developing her training skills and on satisfying her education requirements so that she can graduate on time.

Hanine is the sweet lady on the far right side of the picture with grey top. As for the other group members, Samar is the first from the left, Rabiaa is the second from the left, and Rania is the second from the right.

loans.use: To cover the increase in tuition fees

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is a 40-year-old widow who is taking care of four children. She has been a farmer for ten years, earning an income of KES 10,000 at the end of every month. 

Hannah was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a neighbor and is now servicing her first loan of KES 20,000. She intends to use the entire loan amount to buy more inputs, seedlings and fertilizers for her farm. Hannah plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children and to open a general store. She hopes to become a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizers for her farm plantation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy oil, rice, and fish

loans.name: Aybaniz

texts.en:
Aybaniz is a 51-year-old, married woman with two children. She lives with her family in the Boyuk-Bahmanli village of the Füzuli region. For 20 years, they have been internally displaced persons from their native land, Füzuli city.

To earn a living, Aybaniz has a few cows and has been in the agriculture business for 12 years. She prepares dairy products (cheese, yogurt, etc.) and sells those products in the local bazaar and to her neighbors for a profit.

Now she is seeking a loan in the amount of 2,100 AZN to better ensure her cows' safety. Specifically, she wants to repair the cows' stall. She would also like to use a portion of the loan proceeds to buy two cows. She is thankful to the Kiva organization for help and support.

loans.use: to repair her cows' stall and to purchase additional cows

loans.name: Johnalyn

texts.en:
Johnalyn is a 44-year-old, married woman. She is married to a fisherman. They have five children: one is married; three work; and one is an infant.

She is thankful for her husband being so supportive of her efforts to improve their retail store. Johnalyn has operated her retail store for more than 15 years.

Johnalyn is now requesting a loan in the amount of 15,000 PHP to allow her to buy grocery items, such as cooking oil, eggs, noodles, sugar, soap and Nescafe, for re-sale purposes. She is hoping that, with the benefit of the loan proceeds, she can improve her retail store and earn more profits.

loans.use: to expand and improve her retail store by purchasing additional groceries (e.g., cooking oil, eggs, noodles, sugar, soap and Nescafe) for re-sale purposes

loans.name: Multietnicas Group

texts.es:
Está integrado por cuatro mujeres, que se organizaron hace 3 años, con el propósito de acceder a financiamiento, para comprar mercadería para sus pequeñas pulperías que han establecidos cada una de las integrantes. El nombre de MULTIETNICAS, es porque está conformado por mujeres de diferentes grupos étnicos, sin importar diferencias de cultura, lengua, raza e historia, bajo una identidad social común, que es mejorar su calidad de vida. 

Irma Isabel: Es una mujer amable y luchadora, tiene 40 años de edad, casada, tiene 5 hijos. Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente ingreso, desde hace 7 años estableció una pequeña pulpería y vende nacatamales y comidas rápidas de jueves a domingo. Solicita financiamiento para comprar insumos para elaborar sándwich, hamburguesas, hot dog, fritos, entre otros productos. Su sueño es tener una distribuidora.
texts.en:
This group is made up of four women who organized themselves three years ago with the goal of accessing financing to buy merchandise for the little convenience stores that each one of the members had established. The group name is "Multietnicas" (Multiethnics) because it is formed by women of different ethnic groups, regardless of the differences in culture, language, race, and history, under one common social identity, which is to improve their quality of life.

Irma Isabel is a friendly and hard-working woman. She is 40 years old, married, and has 5 children. She is the coordinator of the solidarity group. With the goal of having her own source of income, she established a little convenience store seven years ago and sells nacatamales and fast food from Thursday to Sunday. She is applying for financing to buy supplies to make sandwiches, hamburgers, hot dogs, and fried foods, among other products. Her dream is to have a distributorship.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make sandwiches, hamburgers, hot dogs, and fried foods, among other products.

loans.name: Merries

texts.en:
Merries is a 49-year-old single woman who is blessed with three children. She has been running a retail shop, along with a grocery stall as a secondary business, for eight years, earning an income of KES 8,000 at the end of every month.

Merries was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a credit officer and is now servicing her first loan of  KES 20,000. She intends to use the entire loan amount to buy cooking fat, maize flour, wheat flour, detergents and tea leaves, which are running out of stock. Merries will be able to pay school fees for her children with the anticipated profits. She hopes to build a permanent house for her family.

loans.use: to buy cooking fat, maize flour, wheat flour, detergents and tea leaves to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a 32-year-old lady who is married and blessed with two children ages 11 and three years old. She operates a hardware shop and this has been her business for the last seven years with a monthly income of Kenya shilling 55,000. This income together with her husband's is able to cater to her family's needs and keep the business running.

She has applied for her first loan after joining VisionFund Kenya and she will use this amount to add stock of scrap metal and timber, which her clients are buying more for constructing new buildings. Her anticipated profits will be used to save towards her children's education and grow her business.

In the future, she would like to expand her business to other areas as well and see her children well educated.

loans.use: to purchase scrap metal and timber stock

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 39 years. She is married to Kioko and together they have been blessed with two children. 

Mary is in the food business selling French fries, commonly referred to as 'chips' in Kenya. She has done this business for the last 11 years, earning a monthly income of KES 6,000.

Mary has requested her fourth loan of KES 30,000 with VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to buy sacks of potatoes to make chips.

With the anticipated profits, Mary will be able to educate her children. Her hope and dream is to have a stable life.

loans.use: to buy sacks of potatoes to make chips

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 64-year-old married man who supports a family of six children and his wife adds additional income to the family. Joseph operates a retail business which has been in operation for seven years, earning himself an income of KES 10,000 at the end of every month.
 
Joseph was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a credit officer and is now servicing his first loan of KES 30,000. He intends to use this amount to buy phone accessories and perfumes to add to his stock.

Joseph plans to use the anticipated income to open up a boutique and hopes to have a bright future with a lot of success and provide the best quality education to his children.

loans.use: to buy phone accessories and perfumes to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman aged 31 years. She is married to Cyrus and together they have been blessed with two children of three and one years. Cyrus is in the transport business, hence provides additional income for the family.

Elizabeth sells clothes, a business she has done for the last two years, earning a monthly income of KES 12,000. She has requested for a loan of KES 20,000 which she will use to buy clothes for re-sale.

With the anticipated profits, Elizabeth will be able to save enough money for the future. Her hopes and dreams are to open a business for her husband.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goods to sell such as oil, rice, salt, pepper and meat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more oil, rice, salt, pepper, coconut, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Maura

texts.es: Maura: Es una mujer trabajadora, madre soltera de dos hijos adolescentes. Desde hace más de 5 años habita en una casa de tambo de madera. Con el propósito de construir su vivienda de concreto, solicita su segundo financiamiento para  comprar 300 bloques. Su sueño es brindarle a su familia una vivienda segura y con las condiciones adecuadas y velar por el desarrollo humano y profesional de u hijos.
texts.en:
Maura: is a hardworking woman and a single mother of two teenagers. For more than 5 years, she has lived in a stilt house. With the objective of building a concrete house, she is requesting a second loan to buy 300 blocks.

Her dream is to give her family a safe household with the right conditions, and to look after their children’s personal and professional development.

loans.use: to buy 300 blocks.

loans.name: Debora Del Carmen

texts.es: Debora del Carmen: Es una joven luchadora, originaria de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 24 años de edad, casada, tiene 1 hijo de 6 años de edad, es docente de primaria. Su esposo es buzo. Desde hace aproximadamente 7 años vive en hacinamiento en casa de familiares. Con el propósito de vivir de manera segura y digna, solicita financiamiento para terminar de construir su propia vivienda de tambo de madera, comprar materiales: Postes de madera, madera cepillada, clavos, zinc y cubrir cotos de mano de obra. Su sueño es estudiar su carrera universitaria y especializarse como en Ciencias Naturales.
texts.en: Debora del Carmen is a young fighter, a native of Puerto Cabezas. She is 24 years old, is married and has one six year old child. She is a Primary school teacher. Her husband is a diver. For about 7 years she has lived in a family member's house. With the goal of living in a more secure and dignified manner she is requesting a loan to complete the construction of her own wooden stilt house. She needs to buy materials: wood posts, planed wood, nails, zinc laminate and to pay for labor. Her dream is to study at university and specialize in natural sciences.

loans.use: to buy wooden posts, planed wood, nails, zinc laminate and pay for labor.

loans.name: Yafal's Group

texts.fr:
Ce banc villageois a été crée le 24 octobre 2012. Il est regroupe des femmes qui habitent le même village et ceux des alentours. La plupart pratique le commerce. Une bonne entente règne dans le groupe.
Bineta la présidente du banc est debout sur la photo, elle porte le boubou de couleur multicolore, vert violet. Elle est âgée de 57 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants et à en charge ses petits enfants. Elle est une femmes dynamique et s'active dans toute activité qui peut lui faire gagner de l'argent. Elle envisage d'acheter un mouton à 30000f et des légumes qu'elle vend dans les marchés hebdomadaires et dans son village. Une activité qu'elle trouve bien rentable.
Avec les bénéfices elle assure la dépense quotidienne et compte construire sa maison
texts.en:
This ’banc villageois’ was created on October 24, 2012. It is composed of women who live in and around the same village. Most of them work in commerce. Good relations reign in the group. Bineta, the president of the ‘banc’, is the one standing in the photo. She is wearing a multi-colored green and violet boubou [long flowing outfit]. She is 57 years old and a married mother of two children, and she has grandchildren to support. She is an energetic woman and active in anything that can earn money for her. 

She envisions purchasing a sheep for 30,000 francs and some vegetables she sells at the weekly markets in her village. This is a business she finds to be very profitable. With the profits, she ensures that the day-to-day expenses are covered and is planning on building a house.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and vegetables

loans.name: Kadiatou's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe est né le 07 Mai 2009 à l'inauguration du Banc villageois, ces femmes ont pu acquérir une expérience solide dans le programme après 10 cycles soit environ 05 années de vie commune. Les membres du groupe habitent dans le même village  et sont animés d’un esprit d’entre aide et de soutien mutuel. Elles sont très actives dans le commerce et pratique  la culture vivrière sous pluie.

Madame Kadiatou (assise à droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 36 ans et mariée, c’est une femme très dynamique et a su faire croître son activité au fil des cycles. Elle  s’active de la vente de production de pâte d’arachide une activité à fort rentabilité dans la zone. Pour se faire elle achète les graines d’arachide non décortiquées par sac de 50 Kg le plus souvent au marché hebdomadaire international de la sous région, pour ensuite mené son activité de transformation qu’elle maîtrise à merveille.
 
Son nouveau prêt, elle compte s’approvisionner par vague de 02 sacs de 50 Kg pour la transformation et la vente par seau de 20 Kg et 05 Kg.

Les retombées lui permettront d’une part à développer sa capacité d’autofinancement en renforçant son épargne et d’autre part à mieux participer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
The group was created on May 7, 2009, when the ’banc villageois’ was inaugurated.  The women of the group were able to acquire solid experience in the program after ten loan cycles, being about five years of communal living. The group members live in the same village and are guided by mutual assistance and support. They are very active in commerce and in growing staple foods during the rainy season. 

Ms. Kadiatou (sitting at the right with a hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. She is 36 years old, married, and a very energetic woman. She figured out how to grow her business over the cycles. She is active in producing and selling peanut butter. It is a highly profitable business in the area. To do this, she purchases unshelled peanuts by the 50-kg sack most often at the international weekly market in the sub-region. Next she does her processing work, which she has mastered wonderfully.

With her new loan, she plans on stocking up with a quantity of two 50-kg sacks [of peanuts] for processing and selling by the pail in 20-kg and 5-kg sizes. 

The returns will enable her in part to develop her ability to finance herself by bolstering her savings, as well as to do more to help improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to stock up on peanuts to process into peanut butter to be sold by the pail

loans.name: Ruth De Kuiti Group

texts.fr:
Mme RUTH est le responsable du groupe RUTH DE KUITI.  Mariée, elle est mère de 03enfants. Le plus âgé a 06ans et le moins a 03mois. Personne ne  va à l’école.
Mme fait l’agriculture depuis plus de 05ans. Elle s’approvisionne au  marché de son secteur et dans les villages environnants.
Elle veut s’acheter 05sacs d’engrais pour sa culture.
Mme veut utiliser ses bénéfices afin de renforcer dans son activité. Elle ambitionne améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. RUTH is the official of the group RUTH DE KUITI. She is a married mother of three children. The oldest is 6 years old, and the youngest is 3 months. None is in school. 

Ms. RUTH has been farming for over five years. She gets her supplies at the market in her sector and from surrounding villages. She wants to purchase 5 sacks of fertilizer for her farm work. She wants to use her profits to bolster her business. Her ambition is to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase 5 sacks of fertilizer for her farm work

loans.name: Sidpassamde De Pikioko Group

texts.fr:
Mr ISSAKA est le responsable du groupe SIDPASSAMDE DE PIKIOKO.  Marié, il est père de 03enfants. Le plus âgé a 07ans et le moins a 01an. Personne ne  va à l’école.
Mr fait le jardinage depuis plus de 12ans. Il s’approvisionne au  marché de son secteur.
Il veut s’acheter des intrants (05sacs d’engrais et 03kg d’insecticides) pour son jardinage.
Mr veut utiliser ses bénéfices afin de renforcer dans son activité. Il ambitionne améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. ISSAKA is the official of the group SIDPASSAMDE DE PIKIOKO. He is a married father of three children. The oldest is 7 years old, and the youngest is 1. None goes to school. 

Mr. ISSAKA has been working at market gardening for over twelve years. He gets his supplies at the market in his sector. He wants to purchase some farm inputs (5 sacks of fertilizer and 3 kg of insecticides) for his crops. He wants to use his profits to bolster his business. His ambition is to improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs (fertilizer, insecticides) for her market garden

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is a 67-year-old man who is married to Esther and together they are blessed with six children. He runs a hardware store where his wife assists him, but she also runs her own business. She rears poultry and sells eggs which contributes to the family's total income. 

This is Geoffrey's second loan, and he plans to use it to stock more cement and sand in his hardware store as these items are running low right now and construction businesses are really booming in his area. He anticipates making profits which he will invest back into the business.

In the future he hopes to be a successful businessman.

loans.use: to add more stock of cement and sand

loans.name: Majeste Group

texts.fr:
Mr KOUKA est le responsable du groupe MAJESTE.  Sur la photo, il est habillé en  chemise bleu  et tient deux petites  papayes dans sa main gauche et une grosse papaye dans sa main droite. Marié, il est père de 05enfants. Le plus âgé a 15ans et le moins a 02ans. 04 vont à l’école.
Mr est agriculteur depuis plus de 20ans. Il s’approvisionne au  marché de son secteur et alentour.
Il veut s’acheter 10sacs d’engrais et 05kg d’insecticides pour sa culture.
Mr veut utiliser ses bénéfices afin de réinvestir dans son activité. Il ambitionne augmenter les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. KOUKA is the official of the group MAJESTE. In the photo, he is the one wearing a blue shirt and holding two small papayas in his left hand and big one in his right. He is a married father of five children. The oldest is 15 years old, and the youngest is 2. Four go to school. 

Mr. KOUKA has been a farmer for over twenty years. He gets his supplies from a market in and around his sector. He wants to purchase 10 sacks of of fertilizer and 5 kg of insecticides for his crops. He wants to use his profits to reinvest in his business. His ambition is to improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and insecticides for his farm work

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 47 years old. He is married to Teresia. Teresia helps provide additional income for the family through farming. Peter supports three members of his family.

Peter is a tailor, a business he has done for the last six years, earning a monthly income of KES 12,000. He has requested his first loan of KES 20,000 with VisionFund Kenya, which he will use to purchase more stock of cloth materials for sewing and selling.

With the anticipated profits, Peter will be able to educate his children. His future dream is to purchase land and build a home for his family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of cloth material

loans.name: Sougounda's Group

texts.fr:
Créer depuis  son inauguration le 15 Mai 2008, le banc villageois est composé femmes qui habitent le même quartier et partagent un objectif commun mener des activités de petit commerce afin d’être utile à leur famille respective. Elles jouissent de plus de cinq années d’expérience dans le programme. Elles font comme activité secondaire l’agriculture sous pluie.

Madame Sougounda (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 48 ans, est mariée  et mère de 05 enfants dont 03 garçons et 02 filles. Son activité s’inscrit dans l’achat de graine d’arachide non décortiquée qu’elle conserve pour la revendre au moment opportun avec une marge bénéficiaire consistante. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine pour l’avoir pratiqué pendant plus de 10 ans.

Avec ce prêt elle prévoit d'acheter une dizaine de sacs d’arachide de 50 kg à 15 000 Fr CFA pour la revente après par kg au prix de 500 Fr CFA.

Les  bénéfices, en plus de l’aider à augmenter son épargne, l’aideront à mieux contribuer au bien être de la famille.
texts.en:
Created since the inauguration of the ’banc villageois’ on May 15, 2008, this group is composed of women who live in the same district and who share a common goal running small-scale businesses in order to be useful to their respective families. The women enjoy over five years of experience in the program. As a secondary business, they farm during the rainy season. 

Ms. Sougounda (sitting at the far right with a hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. She is 48 years old and a married mother of five children (3 boys and 2 girls). Her business involves buying unshelled peanuts that she keeps and then resells at the right time with a significant profit margin. She has good experience in this domain for having done it for over ten years.

With this loan, she plans on purchasing a dozen 50-kg sacks of peanuts at 15,000 francs CFA each. Then she will resell them later at 500 francs per kilo. 

In addition to helping her to grow her savings, the profits will allow her to help with her family’s well-being.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of peanuts to resell

loans.name: Meri

texts.en:
Meri is a 34-year-old married woman. She lives in Kutaisi district with her two sons and a pensioner mother-in-law. Her husband lives abroad. Meri works as a saleswoman at a local pharmacy and earns a small salary, which is not enough for her family. 

Meri decided to start her own business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables Meri to get a loan of 1,500 USD. With the loan, she will purchase handbags, which she will sell to villagers at a higher retail price. This will increase her family's income and she will be able to improve the living conditions of her children. Meri awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin a business selling handbags.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy enough lappas to sell.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en: Pedro (pictured second from right), who works alongside his family, is a jewelry artisan from Guatemala who specializes in jade and sterling silver pieces. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of silver and jade. Pedro has been selling through NOVICA since 2010. This is his story: After working for silversmiths for six years, Pedro and his family decided to open their own workshop. They are all involved in the family business. "We've developed a good working relationship," says Pedro. "Everyone specializes in a different aspect and we complement each others' work." "I am very grateful for another opportunity to receive microcredit. These loans have helped us to continue improving our operation and purchase raw materials at a better price. We recently lost several large jade stones to theft; each stone weighed over 50 pounds, so it was a big loss for us and it brought our production down to a very low level. With this new microcredit, we will be able to obtain the jade and silver we need to get production back on track, as well as develop new styles that we can make available for purchase on the website." Use the link below to view Pedro's hand-crafted jade and sterling silver jewelry on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/7566

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of silver and jade for his jewelry making business.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 71-year-old lady who has been blessed with five children who are all adults. Her children are all married with their own families. Jane has been in the property rental business for 15 years and she is able to make good profits, which provide for all her basic needs.

Jane has currently applied for her fourth loan, which she intends to use to build more rental houses to address the need for rental houses. She anticipates profits, which she will use to expand her plot of land and take care of her grandchildren.

She hopes to have a brighter future.

loans.use: to build more rental houses.

loans.name: Marvis Joelly

texts.es: Marvis Joelly: Es una mujer luchadora, tiene 39 años de edad. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingreso, desde hace 3 años estableció una pulpería venta de accesorios para damas de acero. Solicita financiamiento para comprar en Managua mercadería y venderla a precios accesibles en el Municipio de Puerto Cabezas: Aretes, cadenas, pulseras, anillos, brazaletes, entre otros productos. Su sueño es establecer una distribuidora.
texts.en: Marvis Joelly is a fighter and is 39 years old. With the aim of having her own source of income, she established a convenience store three years ago selling steel accessories for women. She is requesting finances in order to buy merchandise in Managua and to sell it at affordable prices in the Puerto Cabezas Municipality. This includes earrings, purses, bracelets, and rings among other products. Her dream is to establish a distribution.

loans.use: to buy merchandise in Managua.

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en:
Johnson is a permanent resident of a village in Rugando, Mbarara district. He is married with eight children, as well as four dependents from his brother who died five years ago. 

Johnson grew up with only a mother, as his father was not known to him, and his mother made his life difficult. Being pushed by the need to survive and to support his mother, he started banana farming on a small scale on the land he got from his grandmother. This banana plantation was used as a source of food for the family and income for their survival. 

Johnson is a hardworking man who managed to start other businesses, like poultry. These businesses have grown, giving him an opportunity to support his family and dependents, and to construct a house for his family. 

He is requesting for a loan of 4,000,000 UGZ to buy organic manure for his banana plantation. He hopes this will increase his yields and income. He is hard working and is appreciative of the support of Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy organic manure for his banana plantation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goods, such as rubber tubs, buckets, dishes, etc., for resale.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
The warmth and joy radiating from Olivia every time she talks about her business is undeniable. A fashionista from the day she was born, Olivia spent her early years altering and mending clothes for herself and her six siblings.

Later in life, her love for fashion brought her to a major upscale clothing boutique, where Olivia climbed the ranks to store manager. It was while she was working in the fashion industry that Olivia had the epiphany that started her on the path to entrepreneurship: there are plenty of places to get inexpensive and practical clothes for kids. There are also places to get fashionable clothes for kids, though they are often flimsy and impractical. But there just isn’t anywhere to get fashionable clothes for kids that are well-wrought and practical.

This great idea marked the beginning of a lot of hard work and struggle to turn an idea into a business. Between securing funding, dealing with manufacturing and logistics, and designing an entire line of children’s clothing from scratch, Olivia has had no trouble keeping busy recently.

With the help of her head designer, who she met back when she was managing the upscale boutique, Olivia has her eyes set on creating the next great fashion empire. She will use her Kiva loan to pay for patterns and samples, inventory, and costs associated with creating a new website. This is a unique opportunity for Kiva donors to say they helped make America’s next great brand a reality.

loans.use: to pay for inventory, patterns, samples, and website start-up costs.

loans.name: Sharifah

texts.en: Sharifah is a permanent resident of Nyakaizi, a village in Mbarara District. She is 38 years old and married, with four children, as well as one dependent from her brother who is elderly. All her children and the dependent are in school. From childhood, Sharifah has been a farmer, growing and selling matooke (banana) until 2014, when she learned about the existence of Ugafode microfinance, which funded her with a loan of 1,000,000 UGX to complete construction of her rentals. This made her prosper in life and she even managed to build other houses for rent. She is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 UGX to complete her rentals in order to get an additional source of income.

loans.use: to buy cement, paint  and lime

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Spending just a few minutes in Lucy’s nurturing presence, it’s easy to see why she decided to start a business caring for the elderly and infirm. All through her life, whenever a family member fell ill, Lucy was first to step up and lend her time and energies toward helping that person recover.

Lucy was very close to her grandmother growing up, so she was devastated to learn that her grandmother had developed Alzheimer’s and was put in an institution while she was away at college. Lucy decided then and there that she would do everything possible to keep her loved ones from ending up in institutions.

Later on, when she saw her sister run a successful in-home care business in South Carolina, Lucy came to the conclusion that this would be her ticket to financial independence. Her sister has been running the in-home care business for 15 years, and Lucy has found her advice about how to start another operation in San Diego to be invaluable.

But business strategies don’t always translate perfectly from one state to another, as Lucy has found. Regulations in California are often very different from South Carolina when it comes to the elderly and infirm, which left Lucy without any easy answers coming from her sister. Nonetheless, with time and hard work, Lucy has managed to clear all the regulatory hurdles she’s encountered, and is ready to take the next step forward.

Lucy will spend her Kiva loan on initial office setup costs and covering payroll during the early phases of her business. If there is any money left over, Lucy hopes to start building a reserve so that she can cover payroll in the event that there is some delay in Medicare payouts.

Ultimately, she derives most of her satisfaction at the job from knowing that she is keeping her clients at home and out of institutions. When Lucy sees a discharged patient make a full recovery or an elderly client be able to maintain independence, it reminds her why she started her business in the first place.

loans.use: to pay payroll and initial office setup costs.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena: Es una mujer amable y luchadora, tiene 62 años de edad, es madre soltera con 3 hijos, mayores de edad. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos y sacar adelante a sus hijos, desde hace 6 años vende de manera ambulante prendas de plata, oro laminado y ropa interior. Solicita financiamiento, para comprar mercadería en Managua y venderla a precio accesible. Su sueño es tener un negocio prospero.
texts.en: Elena: She is a friendly woman and a fighter. She is 62 years old, a single mother with three children, who are older. For the past six years, with the goal of having her own source of income and helping her children to get ahead, she has done traveling sales of silver items, gold laminate, and undergarments. She is requesting financing to purchase merchandise in Managua and sell it at an affordable price. Her dream is to have a prosperous business.

loans.use: to purchase silver items, gold laminate items, and undergarments.

loans.name: Maria Estela

texts.es: Maria Estela: Es una mujer amable y trabajadora, originaria de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 32 años de edad. Con el objetivo de construir su tanque séptico. Solicita financiamiento para construir inodoro y comprar materiales: hierro, bloque, cemento, clavos y madera. Su sueño es construir un muro de concreto para su vivienda.
texts.en:
Maria Estela is a kind and hardworking woman, originally from Puerto Cabezas and is 32 years old. Her objective is to build a septic tank. She is requesting financing in order to build the toilet and to buy materials such as iron, bricks, cement, nails and wood. 

Her dream is to build a concrete wall for her home.

loans.use: to build a toilet.

loans.name: Uwakite Group

texts.en:
Robert, who is in his mid 50s, is married with five children; two of them are adults and three are still in school. Robert has been running a grocery store since 2010. He works from 8pm to 11pm daily, and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Robert's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He will use this loan to buy beer, sodas, spirits, wine, water and juice for resale. He dreams of building a guest house.

Robert will share this loan with his loan group, Uwakite Group, which has five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy beer, sodas, spirits, wine, water and juice for resale.

loans.name: Monrovia Group

texts.en:
Amina, who is in her late 40s, is not married and has three sons who are in school. For three years now, she has been supporting her family by running a mamalishe (an eatery) and frying cassava. She starts mamalishe from 6am to noon, just cooking and selling breakfast and lunch foods. Thereafter, Amina take off to 4pm where she starts frying cassavas for selling, and works until 8pm daily. She is able to make a good profit each month. 

This is her second loan request via Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans, since repaid, to buy cooking charcoal, baking flour, cooking oil and some kilos of rice. She is so proud with Kiva's support. She used her extra business income to cover school fees and household expenses. She desires to build a house for her family. Amina will use this loan to buy fruits and vegetables for her new genge business. She wants to open a genge selling fruits and vegetable so as to increase her income.

She will share this loan with her loan group, Monrovia Group, which consists of five members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables for her new business.

loans.name: Mariama's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois est créé le 15 Mai 2008 jour de son inauguration. Il regroupe des femmes qui vivent ensemble depuis plus de deux décennies et partagent des valeurs de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce, elles font aussi de l’agriculture sous pluie.

Madame Mariama (debout au milieu), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée, mère d’un garçon. Malgré son jeune âge 26 ans elle incarne le dynamisme de la nouvelle génération du groupe et est très dynamique dans son commerce. Elle fait de la transformation de pâte d’arachide qu’elle vend à la capitale et au retour achète des produits manufacturés pour la revendre dans les villages.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle prévoit d’acheter des sacs d’arachide à 7 000 Fr CFA engage de frais de transformation de 1 500 Fr CFA pour revendre le seau de 20 kg à 15 000 Fr CFA.

Ses bénéfices lui permettront d’accroître son épargne, de venir à bout de ses besoins personnels et de soutenir son mari dans la gestion des charges de la famille.
texts.en:
The ’banc villageois’ was created on May 15, 2008, when it was inaugurated. It is composed of women who have been living together for over two decades; they share values of solidarity and mutual assistance. Their main work involves small-scale commerce, and they also farm during the rainy season. 

Ms. Mariama (standing in the middle) is the featured borrower of the group. She is a married mother of a boy. Despite her young age of 26, she embodies the dynamism of the new generation of the group and is very energetic in her commerce. She processes peanuts to be sold and purchases manufactured products on the way back home to be resold in the villages. 

With her new loan, she plans on purchasing sacks of peanuts at 7,000 francs CFA each, paying for processing at a cost of 1,500 francs, and then reselling the product by the 20-kg pail at 15,000 francs. 

Her profits will enable her to grow her savings, to overcome her personal needs, and to support her husband in managing family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of peanuts, pay for processing, and resell the product by the pail

loans.name: Fatoumata Binta's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe crée depuis Mai 2011,est constitué de 28 membres qui habitent tous dans la même localité.Leur activité principale est le commerce.

Dieynabou se trouvant debout a gauche de la photo et levant le bras,est notre emprunteuse vedette. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre enfants dont 02 garçons et 02 filles.Elle pratique le petit commerce comme activité.

Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter de la marchandise comme l'oignon ,le poivre et divers pour développer son activité.

Pour son bénéfice, elle va participer aux charges familiales et améliorer son épargne.
texts.en:
This group, created since May 2011, is composed of 28 members, who all live in the same town. Their main work involves commerce. 

Dieynabou, standing at the left in the photo with an arm raised, is our featured borrower. She is a married mother of four children (2 boys and 2 girls). She has a small-scale business as her work.

With her loan, she intends to purchase some merchandise, such as onions, black pepper, and more for developing her business. 

With her profit, she is going to help cover family expenses and to improve her savings.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise (onions, black pepper, and more...)

loans.name: Jesus Andres

texts.es: Andres es un joven trabajador de 20 años de edad, el obtuvo su bachillerato hace un año atrás  y en este tiempo se está dedicando a la agricultura juntamente con su padre, Andres cuenta que su padre le enseña a cultivar las plantas y que aunque estaba asistiendo a clases en la tarde se dedicaba a sembrar y cuidar sus cultivos, en la actualidad tiene un cultivo de 1000 plantas de mora y el crédito necesita para comprar fungicidas para tener sus cultivos sanos, Andres espera seguir trabajando y juntar algo de dinero para el próximo año entrar a la universidad.
texts.en: Andres is a young, 20-year-old worker. He earned his high school diploma a year ago, and at this time, he is farming with his father. Andres says that his father is teaching him to cultivate plants and that although he is going to classes, in the afternoon he plants and cares for his crops. Currently, he has a crop of 1,000 blackberry plants, and he needs the loan to purchase fungicides to have healthy crops. Andres hopes to continue working and save some money so he can enter the university next year.

loans.use: to purchase fungicides.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water pump.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goods, such as oil, rice, salt and pepper, for resale.

loans.name: Nancy Helena

texts.es: Elena reside en un lugar donde la mayoría de personas  tiene como principal fuente de ingresos la agricultura, ella es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 3, 7, 11 y 19 años de edad de los cuales los 3 mayores están estudiando, juntamente con su esposo trabajan duro para poder cubrir todos los gastos que implica mantener su hogar, Elena va a invertir el crédito en la compra de fungicidas, abono y pagar de mano de obra a las personas que le ayuden el cuidado de sus plantas, ella es una mejer colombiana que espera obtener una buena cosecha y seguir trabajando para quedarse viviendo en Ecuador  ya que aquí tienen mejor calidad de vida sus hijos.
texts.en: Elena lives in a place where the majority of people have farming as their main source of income. She is married and has four children who are three, seven, 11, and 19 years old. Of them, the three older ones are studying. Along with her husband, she works hard to be able to pay for all of the expenses related to maintaining her household. Elena is going to invest this loan in purchasing fungicides and compost and paying for helping hands that will help her care for her plants. She is a Colombian woman who hopes to have a good harvest and continue working in order to continue living in Ecuador because here her children have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and compost.

loans.name: Amanda Yajaira

texts.es: Amanda tiene un hijo de 6 meses de edad con el que vive muy contenta juntamente con su esposo, Amanda se dedica 10 años a la agricultura de cebolla y otros productos, comenta que con su esposo le dan el debido cuidado  a sus cultivos, ella va a invertir el crédito en la compra de tarros de cebolla para semilla que va a sembrar, ella aspira salir adelante y en un futuro mejorar la calidad de vida de su hijo.
texts.en:
Amanda has a six-month old son with whom she lives very contently together with her husband. Amanda has 10 years of dedicating herself to the agriculture of onions and other products. 

She comments that with her husband they give the due care to their crops. She is going to invest the loan in the purchase of onion jars for seeds that she will sow. She aspires to come out ahead and in the future to improve the quality of her son's life.

loans.use: to buy onion jars.

loans.name: Giovanni

texts.en:
Ask Giovanni what makes his business unique, and he’ll tell you it’s about mixing business with compassion. Working as an accountant and bookkeeper, Giovanni missed the personal interaction that was severely lacking when his head was buried in financial statements all day.

Then, in early 2010, he connected with some old friends who had moved to LA after spending some time working as EMTs in Las Vegas. He started researching the local ambulance care industry and found that there were opportunities for startups, given shifting demographics and the like. Merging Giovanni’s finance and accounting background with his partner’s background in entrepreneurship, they founded Quality 1 Care Ambulance.

Now, Giovanni feels the business is ready to expand from the LA area down to San Diego. Growth rarely comes without setbacks, the greatest of which is finding the right people to staff their new operations. Maintaining accurate and productive communication between employees, ensuring that office staff all get along, and being able to provide accurate arrival time estimates for customers while in the field are just a few of the difficulties in running an ambulance care service.

Nonetheless, Giovanni is confident he will be able to transfer the business model that has worked successfully in LA for the last four years to San Diego. He will use his Kiva loan to pay for costs associated with expansion, including renting an office space, payroll, and buying or leasing vehicles.

For Giovanni, the occasional struggles and headaches are all worthwhile because of the satisfaction he derives from knowing he is providing compassionate care, and treating customers as if they were family. With your help, Giovanni and his employees can continue to preserve life and provide top-notch service in the community.

loans.use: to rent an office space, cover payroll, and buy or lease vehicles.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy an air conditioner and a generator.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and an over sewing machine.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana es soltera pero tiene un hijo Ella vive en El Alto en una casa de adobe que es de su propiedad Juana se dedica a la elaboracion de polleras y mantillas para mujeres de la clase baja de Bolivia conocidas como Cholas Juana podria perjudicar su vista debido a que su actividad le exige poner mucha atencion Juana necesita un credito para comprar materiales de confeccion de polleras y mantillas Ella es la unica fuente de sustento para su hijo por lo que necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Juana is single, but she has a son. She lives in El Alto in an adobe house that is her own. Juana makes skirts and shawls for women of Bolivia's lower class, known as Cholas. Juana could damage her vision because her work demands her to pay so much attention. Juana needs a loan to purchase materials for making skirts and shawls. She is the only source of sustenance for her son, and this is why she needs your help.

loans.use: to purchase materials for making skirts and shawls.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to get more women's shoes.

loans.name: Thiama's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe de femmes qui habitent dans le même quartier; elles ont comme principale activité le commerce. Penda l'emprunteur en vedette est la responsable du groupe, elle est âgée de 34 ans, célibataire et mère d'un garçon. Elle est debout à gauche sur la photo. Elle mène une activité de petit commerce de produits alimentaire en même temps de l’aviculture et capitalise une bonne expérience de plus de 05 ans. Avec son prêt elle compte acheter des marchandises et des poussins . Il y a d'autres boutiques dans le quartier, mais elle n'a pas de problème pour l'écoulement de ses produits aussi pour l'aviculture car elle a une fidèle clientèle.Avec les bénéfices elle paye le scolarité, santé,nourriture  de son enfant et de la famille.
texts.en:
This is a group of women living in the same district. Their main work involves commerce. Penda, the featured borrower, is the group’s official. She is 34 years old, unmarried, and a mother of one boy. She is standing at the left in the photo. She runs a small-scale business selling grocery items. At the same times, she raises poultry and capitalizes on over five years of good experience. 

With the loan, she intends to purchase some merchandise and some chicks. There are other shops in the district, but she has no problem with selling her products or with livestock farming, since she has a loyal customer base. With the profits, she pays for her family’s schooling, healthcare, food.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items

loans.name: Forkland Group

texts.en:
Rosemary, a mother of three school-going children, is married and in her 40s. She has been supporting her family with a shop serving money transfer business (Mpesa and Tigo pesa). She has had her shop since 2007. She starts working from 9am to 10pm daily and is able to make a fair profit. 

Rosemary has been a longtime customer of Tujijenge Tanzania, paying well all of her previous loans. She used the previous loans, since repaid, to recharge her vaults. With the good work she did, Rosemary received extra income, which she used to cover part of school fees and household expenses. In the coming years, she would like to became a successful woman. With her new request, she will increase her business capital (recharge her vault of Mpesa and Tigo pesa).

She will share this loan with her loan group, Forkland Group, which consists of three members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to recharge her vault of Mpesa and Tigo pesa for her money transfer business.

loans.name: Balla

texts.fr:
Balla, est un jeune de 34 ans qui s’active dans le commerce de denrées alimentaires depuis  quelques années. Il possède une mini boutique qu’il a ouverte il y a 3 ans de cela. Il n’a jamais bénéficié de crédit à l’IMCEC et pour acheter des denrées manquantes, de première nécessité comme le riz, le sucre, le lait en poudre, il vient solliciter un montant de 500 000F.
Balla est marié et père de deux enfants, il donne la dépense quotidienne de son foyer, mais appui aussi ses parents qui sont au village.
Son ambition dans l’avenir serait d’ouvrir un grand magasin et d’y stocker beaucoup de marchandises.
texts.en:
Balla is a young man, 34 years old, who has been active in selling grocery items for a few years. He owns a mini-store he opened three years ago.
