He has never benefited from a loan from IMCEC to purchase the grocery items he lacks, basic necessities such as rice, sugar, and powdered milk. He is here to request the amount of 500,000 francs. 

Balla is a married father of two children. He covers his home’s day-to-day expenses, and he also supports his parents, who are in the village. His ambition for the future would be to open a large store and to stock a lot of merchandise in it.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items: rice, sugar, and powdered milk for his store

loans.name: Dora Yanet

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  es la señora Dora, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Cusco Sur” de la ciudad del Cusco - Perú, la socia continua trabajando en la administración pública el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, a la vez la socia continua elaborando chompas, chalinas entre otros de lana, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de eta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar lanas de colores, hilos, entre otros.
La socia Dora está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y por ayudarla con el crecimiento y fortalecimiento de su actividad a la vez se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Our member is Dora. She belongs to the Cusco Sur communal bank in the city of Cusco, Peru. The member continues working in public administration, which is going well for her thanks to the determination she demonstrates each day in her work. At the same time, the member continues making sweaters, scarves, and other wool items. The member is a responsible and diligent person. The member wants to continue working in order to continue supporting her family.

The member is requesting this loan to purchase colored yarn, threads, etc.

The member, Dora, is very grateful to Kiva for allowing her to give her family a better quality of life and for helping her with the growing and strengthening of her business. She promises to make her payments on time, according to the payment schedule.

loans.use: to purchase colored yarn, threads, etc.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  es la señora Gloria, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Cusco Sur” de la ciudad del Cusco - Perú, La socia continua trabajando en su negocio de restaurante, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo  para comprar insumos como arroz, aceite, menestras entre otros.
La socia Gloria está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y por ayudarla con el crecimiento y fortalecimiento de su actividad, a la vez se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Gloria belongs to the “Cusco Sur” ("South Cusco") community bank in the city of Cusco, Peru. She has continued working on her restaurant business. The business is doing well thanks to the effort she puts in to it every day.

She wants to be able to continue working at the restaurant to continue supporting her family. She is asking for the loan to buy ingredients like rice, oil, and vegetables, among other things. Gloria is very grateful to KIVA for allowing her to provide a better quality of life for her family, and for helping her to grow and strengthen her work. She promises to pay her loan according to the established quotas.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like rice, oil, and vegetables among other things

loans.name: Mimoza

texts.en:
Mimoza is a 28-year-old married mother of two children, ages five and three years old. She is requesting this loan to make some home repairs as you can see it from the photograph. 

Mimoza’s village is full of orchards such as figs, apples and peaches, and also grapevines.

Livestock/poultry is Mimoza’s business. She has chickens and pigs, and sells eggs and piglets and chicken to the locals. Being a night man in a school is a job that her husband does, and buying/selling is an activity that he does on his own: he sells a variety of items, including school books and other items for 9th grade schoolchildren. People in their village comment on how nice they are to kids and all other people. They have started building a little house for the family that they haven’t finished yet, due to the shortage of money.

loans.use: to make home repairs, such as plastering walls and installing doors.

loans.name: Eufronio

texts.es: El señor Eufronio vive juntamente con su esposa la señora Sofía y sus hijos, es una  persona trabajadora, se dedica a la agricultura ya que tiene un lote agrícola donde cultiva productos comerciales como la piña y otros que no son muy rentables y como no se venden, son utilizados para consumo propio. Desde hace años atrás viene atravesando ciertas dificultades por la falta de herramientas y apoyo en el manejo de su cultivo porque el costo del jornal subió y es un poco más difícil contratar gran cantidad de personal que le ayuden, ya que sus recursos no le son suficientes solicita un crédito para la compra de nuevas herramientas y para contratar más personal que le podrán ayudar en el manejo mejorando los rendimiento de su cultivo y así mismo mejorara sus ingresos con las cuales podrán vivir mejor.
texts.en:
Eufronio lives with his wife, Sofia, and their kids. He is hardworking, and makes a living in agriculture. He has an agricultural plot, where he grows commercial products like pineapple, as well as others that are not very profitable which he doesn't sell, but uses for his own consumption.

For years, he has come across certain difficultues, such as the loss of tools and support in the management of his crops because the cost of wages grew and it was difficult to hire more hands to help him. Since he does not have sufficient resources, he is asking for a loan to buy more tools and to hire more staff, which will help him better manage his production and also improve his income to better his life.

loans.use: to buy tools for pineapple farming and employ helpers

loans.name: Gjergji

texts.en:
Gjergji, or George in English, is a 28-year-old single man who needs your financial help to buy an engine for his transportation minivan.  He is a very hard worker as others in the village say. He does fishing and transports people to earn a living. 

He lives in a little village situated on the shores of Ohrid Lake. People here do mostly fishing of small wild fish the size of sardines, but with strong needles and scales like a fish -- they’re called ‘cironka’ by the locals, who cook them in an oven with squeezed lemon, black pepper, bay leaves, olive oil, garlic and salt. People here also have several orchards with cherries, apples and nuts, and they sell large quantities of these fruits. As for agricultural land, they don’t have much to plant for selling fresh produce, but farm produce for their own personal use.

loans.use: to buy an engine for his minivan used in his transportation business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her son's higher education fees.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy dairy products, including cheese and milk, for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve his home (plaster the walls, fix his children's room)

loans.name: Mixdalia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Mixdalia del Socorro tiene 26 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos, cuenta con servicios públicos (agua y luz) en el Distrito de Pedregal a 15 minutos de Morropon, una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia del mismo nombre que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza de ganado, comercio de plátano y venta de alimentos preparados por ella misma es una madre emprendedora, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra e variedad de frutas para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Mixdalia del Socorro is 26 years old and lives with her husband and children.  She has utilities (water and electricity) in the district of Pedregal, which is 15 minutes from Morropon.  It is a community with a hot climate whose population works in farming, commerce, and livestock and it is located in the province of the same name in the Piura Region on Peru's north coast.  

For a living, she raises livestock, sells bananas, and sells prepared foods she makes herself.  She is an enterprising mother.  She has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 2,000 nuevos soles to buy a variety of fruits to offer her customers and thereby generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fruits to stock her business.

loans.name: Lluvia De Bendicion Group

texts.en:
Quetzaltenango is the second largest city in Guatemala and an important commercial center. In one of the many neighborhoods of the city, nine hardworking women have formed a Friendship Bridge Trust Bank called “Lluvias de Bendición” or “Blessed Rain”. They are all Maya Kiché and quite proud of their culture and heritage.

Dolores is the President of the Trust Bank. She is 51 years old, married and has three children. She is quite pleased that all three are in school because she understands that with education, they will have more opportunities and their standard of living will be much higher than hers. This dedicated woman sells medicinal plants, vitamins, soaps, lotions and shampoos that are 100% natural. The growing demand for her products motivates her to acquire new products in order to diversify her inventory and increase sales. For these reasons, she is requesting a new loan.

The ladies of the Trust Bank benefit greatly from the educational sessions in their monthly meetings. Acquiring new personal and business tools enables them to have more self-confidence and self-esteem. Friendship Bridge realizes that the combination of the loans and education, which the organization calls “Microcredit Plus”, is quite effective for the ladies to empower themselves. At their monthly meetings, the women learn about how to successfully manage their loans with presentations about accounting, budgeting, pricing, marketing and customer service. Their personal lives are enhanced with knowledge about health, hygiene and nutrition, as well as women’s rights and leadership.

Dolores and the women express their appreciation to Kiva lenders for their kindness in funding the loans. The women promise to work hard and pay the loans back in full and on time. We look forward to reporting on their progress in a future report. Thank you, Kiva lenders!

loans.use: to acquire new medicinal products in order to diversify her inventory and increase sales.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and air-conditioner.

loans.name: Esmeralda Group

texts.en:
San Juan La Laguna is a peaceful village on the shores of Lake Atitlan in Guatemala. It is well-known for the use of natural dyes, including carrots, seeds and leaves. Beautiful textiles are woven using traditional back-strap and foot looms. There are many women’s cooperatives in this town. In addition, the area is farmed with corn, beans and coffee. Animals are raised as well. Entire families participate in these endeavors.

Ten enthusiastic ladies between the ages of 26 and 57 years old have formed the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Esmeraldas” meaning “Emeralds”. They have recently welcomed a new member who is anxious to take out her first loan for her small business!

The President of the group is Gemina who is 27 years old and has two children who are her inspiration. She has attended primary school and appreciates the educational program that Friendship Bridge offers at the monthly meetings of the Trust Bank.  The women acquire personal and business tools, which make them feel more empowered and hopeful about the future. They know that education is vital and work hard so that their children can go to school.

Gemina has a small workspace where she sews cotton clothing in various sizes and designs. She works with her husband in the business and has two employees who are family members. She is requesting a loan that she will use to purchase a sewing machine that will jump start her into a higher level of production. Gemina looks forward to supplying her customers with increased inventory, both in the local market and in the capital, Guatemala City. She reflects that the success of her business is due to her effective business planning and acquired educational knowledge.

The ladies of the “Esmeraldas” Trust Bank and Gemina are very happy to be able to access credit from loans funded by Kiva lenders. Armed with their loans and educational support, the women look forward to a brighter future for themselves, their families and their community of San Juan La Laguna. Thank you, Kiva lenders, for your generosity!

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine that will jump start her into a higher level of production.

loans.name: Milton

texts.es:
Nuestro socio  es el señor  Milton, él pertenece al banco comunal “Cusco Sur” de la ciudad del Cusco - Perú, el socio continua dedicándose al negocio de compra y venta de accesorios y suministros de computo, él socio lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio vende lo que son tintes, hardware y software, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de tintes entre otros.

Milton está muy agradecido con KIVA por permitirle mantenerse en su actividad y apoyando a su familia.
El socio agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
This is our bank member Milton.  He belongs to the Cusco Sur Communal Bank from the city of Cusco, Peru.  He still has his business buying and selling computer accessories and supplies.  He has had this business for a while now and it is going well for him thanks to the effort he puts into it every day.  He sells things like ink cartridges, hardware, and software.  He wants to keep working to keep supporting his family. 

He is requesting this loan to buy ink cartridges, among other things. 

Milton is very thankful to Kiva for allowing hims to keep his business up and support his family.  

He is thankful for this loan and promises to make his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy ink cartridges, among other things

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her daughter's education.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and air-conditioner.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario tiene 64 años de edad, vive en casa propia en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la a brindar servicio de jornalería y fumigación, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de una mochila de fumigar y de esta manera seguir brindando este servicio a sus clientes, generándole ingresos adicionales para su familia.
texts.en:
Mario is 64 years old.  He lives in his own home in the district of Oyotún, a community of farmers, merchants, and ranchers located in the province of Chiclayo, which is part of Lambayeque Region on Peru's north coast. 

He works as a laborer and fumigator for a living.  He has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,000 nuevos soles to buy a backpack fumigator so he can keep offering this service to his customers, which will generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy a backpack fumigator to serve his customers

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es:
Teófilo tiene 50 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge sus hijos, en el distrito de Pucará, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, así como a la venta de los mismos en el merado de su distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de animales y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Teófilo is 50 years old.  He lives with his partner and their children in the district of Pucará, a community of farmers, merchants, and ranchers located in the province of Jaén in the Cajamarca region of Perú's northern mountain range.  

For a living, he raises small animals and sells them in the market in his district.  He has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 500 nuevos soles to buy a greater quantity of animals to generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of animals to offer to his customers.

loans.name: Braulio Luis

texts.es:
Nuestro socio  es el señor  Braulio, él pertenece al banco comunal “Cusco Sur” de la ciudad del Cusco - Perú, el socio continua dedicándose a trabajar para una institución  del estado, el socio lleva buen tiempo trabajando para dicha institución el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, él socio a la vez continua dedicándose al negocio de compra y venta de artesanias,el socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de chompas de alpaca.
Braulio está muy agradecido con KIVA por permitirle mantenerse y crecer en su actividad y por apoyarlo con su familia.
El socio agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
This is our bank member Braulio.  He belongs to the Cusco Sur Communal Bank from the city of Cusco, Peru.  He is still working for a state institution.  He has been working for this institution for a while and it is going well for him thanks to the effort he puts into his work every day.  He also still has his business buying and selling handicrafts.  He wants to keep working to keep supporting his family.  

He is requesting a loan to buy alpaca sweaters.

Braulio is very thankful to Kiva for allowing him to support himself and grow in his business and for supporting his family.  

He is thankful for the loan and promises to make his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy alpaca sweaters

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.es:
Edilberto tiene 53 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Lagunas, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza de ganado lechero, cerdos, pavos y cuyes, venta de alfalfa, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 200 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de los mismos y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Edilberto is 53 years old.  He lives with his wife and children in the district of Lagunas, a community of farmers, merchants, and ranchers located in the province of Chiclayo, which is in the Lambayeque region of Peru's north coast. 

He raises dairy cows, pigs, turkeys, and guinea pigs for a living, as well as selling alfalfa.  He has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 2,200 nuevos soles to buy feed to fatten his animals and thereby generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy feed to fatten his small livestock

loans.name: Deidamia Alejandrina

texts.es:
Deidamia Alejandra tiene 46 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de variedad de animales que le permitan ofrecerlo a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Deidamia Alejandra is 46 years old.  She lives in the district of Oyotún, a community of farmers, merchants, and ranchers located in the province of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region of Peru's north coast. 

She raises and sells small livestock for a living.  She has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,500 nuevos soles to buy a variety of animals to offer her customers and thereby generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy small livestock to offer her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, table and generator.

loans.name: Toafa

texts.en: Toafa is a 77-year-old widow with seven children. She owns and operates a small flea market selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for four years. Toafa needs a loan to buy Samoan t-shirts, printed material, cava bowls, coconut carved earrings, bangles and Samoan designed caps. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses and help with the expansion of her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy Samoan t-shirts, printed material, cava bowls, coconut carved earrings, bangles and Samoan designed caps

loans.name: Solialofi

texts.en:
Solialofi is a 40-year-old married woman with four children. She runs a small bakery in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. 

Solialofi needs a loan to buy bags of flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, baking trays, icing sugar, butter and a large stove. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Solialofi has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, baking trays, icing sugar, butter and a large stove

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and generator.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Elsie works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell fruits business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from farming rice. Elsie is borrowing 29,000 PHP through NWTF to  buy fruits to sell in her food stall.

Elsie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fruits to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Quirina

texts.en:
A married parent of eleven children, Quirina works hard to support her family.

She has a pig fattening business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from farming rice. Quirina is borrowing 14,000 PHP through NWTF to  buy feed and vitamins for her pig fattening business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and has now requested for an additional loan to further build her business.

Quirina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy more boxes of fish to sell. She has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Erlinda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Tofoi

texts.en:
Tofoi is a 35-year-old single woman with 1 child.

She runs a small fishing business in her community to earn a living. She has 2 years of experience in this business. 

Tofoi needs a loan to buy a new fishing canoe, a large cooler, a chest freezer, hooks, baits, flippers and new goggles. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing canoe, a large cooler, a chest freezer, hooks, baits, flippers and new goggles

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 65 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested for a loan of 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items such as shampoo and groceries to sell.

Merlyn has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from farming coconuts.

Merlyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items such as shampoo and groceries to sell.

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia is 56 years old and married with seven children, three of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested for a loan of 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items such as shampoo and groceries to sell.

Celia has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Celia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items such as shampoo and groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 48 years old and married with eight children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more products to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, shampoo, etc.

Jocelyn has borrowed and paid back 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from fish vending.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase more products to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria, aged 54, is married to a farmer and blessed with three children. 

She has been managing a hog raising business in their village for almost seven years, and earns a net income of PHP 500 for every piglet. Every three months her income is spent on their house repairs. 

Due to insufficient funds she would like to take out a loan amounting to PHP 25,000 to purchase a supply of hog feeds. She hopes that her business will continue to grow and become more productive.

loans.use: To purchase a supply of hog feeds.

loans.name: Julina

texts.en:
Julina is 58 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She has been pig fattening for 2 years and also earns additional income from fish vending.

Julina is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a hard working entrepreneur from Cavite, Philippines. She is 34 years old, and has two children who are currently in school. Mario, her husband, works as a driver. She oversees the operation of their jeepney unit, and her income from the business helps with their everyday needs and expenditures.

She has one jeepney unit (of 14-16 person capacity) from which she is paid boundary fees each day. In the boundary system, the driver pays the jeepney owner a fixed amount (called the 'boundary') for driving a passenger vehicle for 12 hours. It is as if the driver is renting the vehicle. What he earns from passenger fares above the boundary fee, minus what he paid for the gas and oil, is his take-home pay.

Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,500 PHP every day. Curiously, jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for every day travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that are typical to the Philippines.

Marilou is requesting a loan of 11,000 PHP to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of her jeepney unit. She will use the profit to improve the general living conditions of her family.

In the future, she hopes for her business to prosper and that she will be able to have expansions. She dreams for her family to always be in good living condition and to lack nothing. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. (All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.)

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their jeepney unit.

loans.name: Hermenia

texts.en:
Hermenia has faithfully paid back her previous loan which she used for her business. 

She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for more than eight years and she earns well from this. Having a bigger family requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her grandchildren. She has to work hard to provide for her family, and is determined to earn a better income. 

To improve sales, Hermenia would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. With PHP 8,000, she could already purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. 

She sincerely sends you her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

Hermenia hopes that her family will always be in good health and that her grandchildren will finish their studies. She also hopes that her children will find new job opportunities. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 54 years old, and married with six children. Five of her children are married and one is still studying. 

Teresita sells milk fish within her village. She is industrious and has a strong determination. 

Teresita would like to purchase 50 kilograms of fresh milk fish and 250 packs of boneless milk fish but her capital is not enough. It is for this reason that she is requesting for a loan of 9,000 PHP. She hopes that her requested loan amount will be granted for a continuous smooth flow of her profits.

loans.use: to buy 50 kilograms of milk fish and 250 packs of boneless milk fish to sell.

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en: Marciana, who is aged 61, is married to a farmer and blessed with two children. She has been managing a hog raising business in their village for almost four years and earns a net income of 3,000 PHP per hog. Her net income is usually spent on their daily expenses. Due to insufficient funds she would like to avail a loan amounting to 17,000 PHP to purchase two hogs to raise, as well as hog feed and vitamins. She hopes that her business will continue to grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase two hogs to raise, as well as hog feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Sithon

texts.en:
Sithon is 48 years old, a famer and a married woman with three children. She has been a farmer since 1984. One of her children is a garment worker, one is taking a police training course, and another is a student. Her husband is a provincial policeman and he has been a policeman for over 26 years. They all live in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. They can earn $14 per day. 

Sithon would like to apply for a loan to buy general home-use products, clothes and all kinds of food to send to her son who has been taking a police training course. This loan will help her son finish the course and become a good policeman. In the future, she is going to buy more farmland to cultivate, renovate her house and support her youngest son to go to university.

loans.use: to buy general home-use products, clothes and all kinds of food to send to her son.

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion has faithfully paid back her previous loan which she used to buy grocery items for her variety store. Aside from this, she also operates a doormat and rug-making business. She has been operating her own rug-making business for some years and she earns well from this. Having a bigger responsibility requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her children. She has had to work hard, with the determination of having better income, to provide her child with better education.

Consolacion appears here in a photo at her variety store.

To improve her profit, Consolacion would like to apply for a new loan. With 10,000 PHP, she could purchase more quantities of raw materials such as fabric, thread and other materials for her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Consolacion hopes to grow her business as well as improve the living conditions of her family and give her children better education. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabric, cloth, thread, needles and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en: Muhammad is a 30-year-old farmer from Maimai.  As a Babban Gona member, Muhammad is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist.  Like all Babban Gona members, Muhammad can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the national average of 14. However, Muhammad is ambitious and is aiming to reap 40 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Muhammad said “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children: Matthew, Samaila, and Mercy, and in 5 years, I want to ensure other members of my community are lifted out of poverty”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Wilson Over

texts.es:
Wilson, en su constante búsqueda del éxito y del progreso, encontró un oficio muy particular y bastante especial.

El se dedica a la producción y venta de dulces y chocolates artesanales en el municipio de Sincelejo, actividad que le ha permitido forjarse un camino y alcanzar un punto equilibrado entre un oficio que le apasiona y que al mismo tiempo le permite generar recursos para sobrevivir.

Inicio en este negocio gracias al acompañamiento de un amigo quien le enseño todo lo relacionado con este trabajo.

El solicita un préstamo para realizar la compra de 2 ollas grandes que le permitan amentar su producción, necesita materia prima como endulzantes, leche, entre otros y por ultimo unas pequeñas cavas para su transporte y conservación.

Este préstamo ayudara a impulsar una actividad muy Colombiana y que día a día toma mucha más fuerza en el mercado.
texts.en:
Wilson is in constant search of success and progress.  He has found a very particular and quite special line of work.

He makes and sells artisan sweets and chocolates in the municipality of Sincelejo.  The business has allowed him to carve out a niche and arrive at a point of equilibrium between a job that he is passionate about one that also allows him to generate an income to survive.

Wilson started the business thanks to a friend of his who taught him all about the job.  He is requesting a loan to buy two big pots to increase production.  He also needs raw materials such as sweeteners, milk and other products, as well as small transportation and refrigeration vehicles.

This loan will help boost a very Colombian activity which has become increasingly strong in the market.

loans.use: To buy two pots, raw materials and transport vehicles.

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en: Haruna is a 25-year-old farmer from Tajiri.  As a Babban Gona member, Haruna is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Haruna can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the national average of 14. However, Haruna is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money  to educate my children; Yusuf ,Yunusa, and Ketura. My overall goal is to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving these goals.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  es la señora Maria Elena, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Cusco Sur” de la ciudad del Cusco - Perú, la socia continua con su negocio de venta de flores y arreglos florales, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  su negocio, la  socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de flores como lirios, margaritras entre otros.
La socia María Elena está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y por ayudarla con el crecimiento y fortalecimiento de su actividad.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Our member’s name is Maria Elena. She belongs to the “Cusco Sur” Communal Bank located in Cusco Peru.  She continues selling flowers and floral arrangements and has been in business for quite some time.  It is going well for her because of the hard work she puts into it every day, and she wants to continue working to support her family.

The loan she is requesting is to purchase flowers such as lillies, daisies and others.  Maria Elena is very grateful to Kiva for helping her give her family a better quality of life and helping her grow and strengthen her business. She is thankful for the loan and agrees to make the payments according to the schedule.

loans.use: To buy flowers such as lillies, daisies, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to produce organic cucumber

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay processing fees to get her professional diploma.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
Gregorio es un hombre de 50 años de edad casado, padre de cuatro hijos y se dedica a la pesca con red.
Él siempre se encuentra de buen humor y alegre, su lengua materna es el aymara y utiliza el español para el comercio, en su negocio su punto de partida es el ‘puerto Villarroel’ (foto) en el lago Titicaca distante a tres horas en auto de la ciudad capital (La Paz), los pescados más comunes en este lugar son; el sábalo, surubí, tambaqui, chuncuina y general.
Gregorio es de tez morena, cabello negro corto y estatura alta, sus manos son duras secas y gruesas como de la mayoría de los pescadores. Su jornada comienza muy temprano por la madrugada antes de la salida del sol, cargado de sus redes de pesca se dirige a su bote para después adentrarse al lago y retornar al medio día para descargar su pesca y arreglar las redes, antes de que termine la tarde se aventura al lago realizando la misma rutina que en la mañana para retornar por la noche y dejar todo listo para el día siguiente, es una labor agotadora que la viene realizando aproximadamente 30 años, su negocio tiene necesidades como la renovación de su bote y la compra de nuevas redes de pesca para poder financiar los gastos escolares a sus cuatro hijos.
Es por esos motivos que Gregorio solicita un préstamo para la compra de un bote y redes de pesca y con los beneficios pagar los gastos de sus cuatro hijos.
texts.en:
Gregorio, 50, is married and has four children.  He is a net fisherman.  He is always cheerful and happy and his native language is Aymara.  He uses Spanish for commerce.  His business is set up in the Puerto Villarroel (photo) on Lake Titicaca which is three hours by car from the capital city of La Paz.  The most common fish in this region are sábalo (tarpon), tambaqui (black pacu), chuncuina and general types. 

Gregorio has a dark complexion, short black hair and is tall.  His hands are very dry and thick like most fishermen's.  His workday begins very early in the morning before sunrise.  Carrying his fishing nets he goes to his boat and out on the lake, returning with his catch at noon to unload the fish and fix the nets.  Before the end of the afternoon he does the same routine as in the morning and returns by night, leaving everything ready for the next day.  It is a tiring job and he has been doing it for approximately 30 years.  His work entails renovating the boat and buying new fishing nets in order to pay for his four children's expenses.

Therefore, Gregorio is requesting a loan to buy a boat and fishing nets so he can use the profits her earns to cover his four children's expenses.

loans.use: To buy a boat and fishing nets, and use his profits to cover his children's expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for his children's education.

loans.name: Divino Nino Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal  Divino niño está conformada por  nueve integrantes,   son originarios de zona rural llamada Achuapa, estas persona se caracterizan por ser trabajadoras responsables con ganas de superación personal, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudieron estudiar y se vieron obligados a trabajar desde muy joven, pero como todas las personas tiene sueños y metas  como es  formar a sus hijos en profesionales,  y mejorar sus vivienda para brindarle estabilidad a su familia, por lo cual lucha día a día para lograr sus objetivos de vida.
Gracia a sus esfuerzos y sus ganas de salir adelante, la coordinadora es  Elsa y tiene por actividad económica una pulpería, es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles como: fósforos, aceite, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, pan, huevo, leche, crema. En cantidades pequeñas, ubicada en su casa de habitación. Ella dedica a su negocio una doce horas diarias, se levanta muy temprano para aprovecha y  hacer compras  dos veces por semana para surtir su negocio, las compras la realiza en el mercado de localidad, lugar que queda alejado de su comunidad tiene que viajar dos veces por semana. A pesar de los esfuerzo que pueda realiza se siente muy sastifecha con  medio de trabajo, ya que ha sido me medio para proveer a su familia y satisfacer sus necesidades.  El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su pulpería, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. La asociación comunal  Divino Niño agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les ofrecen a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Divino Niño Communal Bank is made up of nine members from the rural community known as Achuapa. These people describe themselves as hardworking and responsible with a desire for personal self-improvement.  Unfortunately they weren't able to continue their studies because they needed to work from a very young age. Currently they are fighting hard to complete their dreams such as giving their children education, housing, and stability. 

Thanks to her effort and desire to get ahead, Elsa is the coordinator of the communal bank. She makes a living running a "pulpería." A "pulpería" is a small store that sells food items such as matches, oil, rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, cream.  She dedicates more than 12 hours a day to her business, which is located at her house.  She gets up very early to take advantage of the morning.  Twice a week she does the shopping to stock her store.  Despite the hard work she does she is very satisfied with her job since it has been her means of supporting the family and satisfying their needs.  The goal of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business by purchasing food products so she can earn a better income in the near future. Divino Niño Communal Bank is grateful for the help that Kiva lenders give to low-income people and poor countries like Nicaragua so they have the means for a decent job.

loans.use: To buy products such as rice, beans, sugar, matches, milk, bread, eggs, cream, juices, sodas.

loans.name: Markus

texts.en: Markus is a 52-year-old farmer from Ungwar Gogarma. As a Babban Gona member, Markus, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Markus can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Markus is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, he will be able to access quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will  result in a yield of at least  40 bags of maize per hectare this season.  Markus is hopeful about what the future holds; he  hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, he will finally be able to afford to educate his children; Michiel,  and  Haruna. Markus’s dreams do not end here: “ultimately, I want to make more money for myself and my family”, he expressed.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Yuly Johana

texts.es:
Emprendedora y soñadora son dos palabras que describen muy bien el estilo de vida de Yuly, una mujer que ha trabajado por 7 años en un negocio de cafetería.

Ella desea comprar este negocio ya que la propietaria actual no puede estar al frente del establecimiento por motivos muy personales; es así como Yuly ve su gran oportunidad de progreso en este negocio.

Solicita el préstamo para pagar el valor del negocio y así comenzar en este camino hacia la independencia.

Siendo madre de un niño de 5 años, en lo único que se enfoca es en poder sacarlo adelante brindándole una excelente calidad de vida y educación.
texts.en:
Enterprising and visionary are two words that describe Yuly's lifestyle very well. She is a woman who has worked for 7 years in a coffee shop.

Yuly wishes to buy this coffee shop business due to the fact that the current owner is no longer able to be at the forefront of the establishment for personal reasons. She sees this business as her big opportunity to get ahead. 

She is asking for a loan in order to buy the business and begin her journey on the path to independence. 

Being the mother of a 5 year old boy, she is entirely focused on being able to forge ahead and provide him with an excellent quality of life and education.

loans.use: to buy the coffee shop in which she currently works.

loans.name: Sokhea

They all live in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. All of them earn approximately $55 per day. Now Sokhea would like to request for a loan to buy a cement mixer to use in his work. This loan will help him work faster and earn more income. In the future, he is going to build a new house and support his children to go to university.

loans.use: to buy a cement mixer to use in his work.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en: Lorena, who is 41 years of age, is married and blessed with three children. She owns and has been managing a food vending business in her community for almost fourteen years and earns a net income of 500 PHP daily. In her business she sells ice cream, fish and squid balls for snacks and she roams around the village using her bicycle. Due to inadequate capital for her business she would like to avail a loan amounting to 38,000 PHP to purchase ice cream ingredients, fish, and squid balls to sell. She is hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase ice cream ingredients, fish, and squid balls to sell.

loans.name: Fonotasi

texts.en: Fonotasi is a 49 year old woman who is married with 8 children. She runs a small tailoring business in her community. She has 2 years of experience with this business. Fonotasi has requested a loan to buy a new sewing machine, thread, needles, a measuring tape, a new pair of scissors and material. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, thread, needles, a measuring tape, a new pair of scissors and material.

loans.name: Ana Francisca

texts.es:
Ana es una fiel representante de la cultura indígena Colombiana que esn sus manos tiene toda la historia y tradición del Pais.

Ella se dedica a la elaboración de artículos como bolsos, sombreros, chanclas, carteras entre otros, productos autóctonos y muy típicos del municipio de Sincelejo y sus alrededores. Es una mujer pujante y trabajadora, a lo largo de su vida ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijos con este oficio.

Solicita un apoyo económico para realizar la compra de materia prima que es la caña flecha, un tipo de hierba con el realiza sus trabajos, adicionalmente utiliza barro y otros materiales naturales.

Apoyando a esta mujer estarás impactando la vida y economía de una familia muy tradicional de Colombia.
texts.en:
Ana is a true representative of the indigenous culture of Colombia who holds in her hands all of the history and tradition of the country.

She makes a living making articles like handbags, hats, sandals, and other local products which are very typical of the city of Sincelejo and its surroundings. She is a vigorous and hardworking woman who has been able to support her children with this occupation.

Ana is requesting economic support to purchase the raw material which is caña flecha, a type of grass she uses for her work. She also uses clay and other natural materials. 

By supporting this woman, you will be impacting the life and the finances of a very traditional Colombian family.

loans.use: to buy caña flecha and clay.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
As a way of generating income, Teresita has engaged in a variety store business within her community for almost 12 years now. She is 49 years of age and blessed with children. Her husband, Eddie, works as a carpenter and they are helping each other to provide for their everyday needs.

In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns an income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

Due to financial insufficiency, Teresita wants to make her business more profitable in order to earn a higher income. For this reason, she would like to avail a loan amounting to 20,000 PHP to buy additional grocery items that are needed. Being a kind and friendly mother, she is hoping that she will further improve the business through this financial assistance.

Teresita aspires to grow her business and earn more from it so she can afford to send her children to college. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Jose Eriberto

texts.es:
José, ha confirmado que con ayuda de créditos ha mejorado su negocio y las condiciones de vida familiar, ya que poseen mejor alimentación, vestuario y salud. También ha logrado mantener su buena calificación crediticia.
Seguirá  invirtiendo en el cultivo de granos básicos y se decidió por solicitar un nuevo crédito para comprar abono, semilla, insecticidas, herbicidas, plaguicidas y variadad de estilos de prenda de vestir, con los que espera seguir manteniendo su producción y abastecer tanto a su familia como a sus clientes.
texts.en:
José has confirmed that with the help of the loans, he has improved his business and his family's living conditions. They now have better food, clothing and health. He has also managed to maintain his good credit rating.

He will continue investing in the cultivation of basic grains and has decided to request another loan to buy fertilizer, seeds, insecticides, herbicides, pesticides and a variety of styles of clothing, with which he hopes to maintain his production and supply his family as well as his customers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, insecticides, herbicides, pesticides and a variety of styles of clothing.

loans.name: Ana Magali

texts.es:
Ana Magali tiene 23 años de edad, vive en el caserío de Playa Azul, en la casa de sus padres en el Distrito de Pucará, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente a cultivos como arroz, frutales entre otros, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, en una vitrina ubicada en su domicilio, es una joven emprendedora que se esfuerza por tener una mejor calidad de vida, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de productos para abastecer su negocio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Ana Magali is 23 years old and lives in the village of Playa Azul, in her parents' house in the district of Pucará. It is a community focussed on farming (especially cultivating rice and fruit trees among other things), trade and livestock, located in the Province of Jaén which is part of the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru.

She makes a living selling cosmetics from a display case in her home. Ana is an enterprising young woman who works hard to have a better quality of life. She has requested a loan of 1000 Nuevos Soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy larger quantities of products to supply her business and in this way generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy larger quantities of basic necessities to supply her business.

loans.name: Magaji

texts.en: Magaji remembers feeling depressed  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now,  Magaji, like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Magaji is ambitious and is aiming to reap yields that are higher than both the national and Babban Gona averages. “In 5 years, I want to make more money for myself and my family” expressed Magaji.With this loan, Magaji is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Tambaya

texts.en: Tambaya Kosau is a 53-year-old farmer from Ungan Maigizo Dankwaire.  As a Babban Gona member, Tambaya Kosau is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Tambaya Kosau can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Tambaya Kosau is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, he will be able to access quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will  result in a yield of at least 40 bags of maize per hectare this season.  Tambaya Kosau is hopeful about what the future holds; he  hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, he will finally be able to afford to educate his children; Laraba,  and  Victoria. Tambaya Kosau’s dreams do not end there: “ultimately, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community”, he expressed.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Yahaya

texts.en: Yahaya is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Yahaya joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children Mansir, Mansura, and  Mujaheed. Yahaya is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Yahaya will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Yahaya can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and  earn up to $2000/ha: more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make this year  as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money  to expand my farmland.” Yahaya is not thinking about this year alone; he expressed that his longterm goal is to “make more money for myself and my family.” With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Señor De Muruhuay De Huayaringa Group

texts.es: Nancy tiene 33 años de edad es soltera dedica a brindar servicios de estimulación temprana. Y da en alquiler su auto. El crédito lo invertirá en cursos de especialización de estimulación temprana. Mayor deseo es obtener  su título profesional. El grupo “SEÑOR DE MURUHUAY DE HUAYARINGA” agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Nancy es la primera del lado izquierdo.
texts.en: Nancy is a 33 year old single woman who makes a living providing early stimulation services. She also rents out her car. She will invest the loan in courses specializing in Early Stimulation. Her greatest desire is to obtain a professional qualification. The group Señor de Muruhuay de Huayaringa is grateful to the Kiva investors for the loan they have provided. Nancy is the first on the left in the photo.

loans.use: to pay for courses in Early Stimulation.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
This is Lilibeth. Her previous loan was a big help, as she was able to purchase products for her direct selling business. The loan was also useful in the education of her children. Her income from the loan assisted with her family's everyday expenditures at home. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another loan, this time 50,000 PHP. It will be used to buy additional supplies and merchandise such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics, tupperware, electric fan, a television and other appliances. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from this business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lilibeth hopes to become financially stable and she dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work. She also draws strength and inspiration from her studies of the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of supplies and products like an electric fan, a TV, a rice cooker, an amplifier, DVD players and Tupperware products needed in her business.

loans.name: Yusufu

texts.en: Yusufu remembers not being able to feed his family  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now,  Yusufu, like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. With access to high-quality inputs and training, Yusuf can also reap over 30 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs” expressed Yusufu. With this loan, Yusufu is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Iliya

texts.en: Iliya is a Babban Gona farmer from Galadima. Iliya is driven by one goal: to “ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs.” It is this ambition that led Iliya to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Iliya can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Iliya is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 35 bags per hectare this season. For with this loan, he will finally be able to access the required yield enhancing inputs such as improved seeds. Iliya is hoping that as a result of this expected yield, he will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what changes he would like to make, he said “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland." With this loan, Iliya will be able to access all the inputs and services to make these dreams reality.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides, insecticides and seeds.

loans.name: Hajara Yohanna

texts.en: Hajara Yohanna is a 40-year-old farmer from Galadima.  As a Babban Gona member, Hajara Yohanna is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Hajara Yohanna can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the national average of 14. However, Hajara Yohanna is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season, due to the high quality inputs that she will access with this loan.  When asked how she plans to spend the income she will make from selling her produce, she said: “I plan to use the money  to educate my children: Aliyu, Daniel, and  Gambo. With this loan, she is well on her way to achieving these goals.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María, vive con su compañero de vida y un hijo de 23 años de edad; su negocio es atender un comedor en el mercado municipal en el que también brinda servicio a domicilio,  trabaja todos los días, no tiene ayuda económica del extranjero.
Invertirá en la compra de una cocina, mesas y sillas, renovara los muebles del negocio para que sus clientes estén en un ambiente más cómodo, con el resto surtirá su inventario con materia prima para elaborar la venta de comida comprara aceite, pollo, pescado, carnes, arroz, frijoles, verduras, gas propano, entre otros. Espera agradar a sus clientes, aumentar las ventas e ingresos.
Sus aspiraciones son tener una mejor calidad de vida e ir cancelando sus deudas.
texts.en: Maria lives with her domestic partner and a 23 year old son. Her business is a diner at the municipal market, from where she also does home delivery services. She works every day. She has no financial support from abroad. She will invest the loan in a stove, tables and chairs; she will buy new furniture for her business so that her customers have a more comfortable environment. With the remainder she will stock up her inventory with basic goods to prepare food: she will buy oil, chicken, fish, meats, rice, beans, vegetables, propane gas, among others. She hopes to please her customers and increase sales and earnings. Her goals are to have a better quality of life and pay off her debts.

loans.use: to buy a stove, tables, chairs, oil, chicken, fish, meats, beans, vegetables, propane gas, among others.

loans.name: Union Progreso Group

texts.es: El grupo “UNION PROGRESO” está conformada por socias trabajadoras y empeñosas. Dedicadas al comercio minorista. Carole tiene 33 años de edad es conviviente con 02 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica la venta de comida rápida hace 04 meses por iniciativa propio. Y a la vez vende ropa. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de sillas y mesas de plástico. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Carole es la que tiene a su bebe en brazos
texts.en:
The “UNION PROGRESO” communal bank is made up of hard-working, determined members who work in retail businesses.  Carole is 33 years old and lives with her two dependent children. 

Thanks to her own initiative, she has been selling fast food for the past four months.  She also sells clothing. She will use the money from the loan to buy plastic tables and chairs. The group is grateful to the KIVA investors for the loan they are granting.  Carole is the one pictured with her baby in her arms.

loans.use: to buy chairs and tables.

loans.name: Emele

texts.en: Emele is 49 years old and married with three children. She makes and sells elei printed material to earn a living and has been doing this for one year. Emele has requested a loan to buy material, fabric paint, stencils, brushes, rollers, wooden carved designs and a new cutter. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy material, fabric paint, stencils, brushes, rollers, wooden carved designs and a new cutter

loans.name: Ayuba

texts.en: Ayuba is a 55-year-old farmer from Galadima.  As a Babban Gona member, Ayuba is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Ayuba can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the national average of 14. However, Ayuba is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make as a Babban Gona member, his said, “I plan to use the money  to educate my children: Yakubu,Joshua, and Yushau. My overall goal is to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving these goals.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Josefina tiene 31 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de La Matanza, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de chicha de jora, cerveza, crianza de aves entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de cerveza para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Josefina is 31 years old and lives with her husband and children in the district of La Matanza, a community focussed on farming, trade and livestock, located in the Morropon Province in the Piura Region on the north coast of Peru.

She makes a living selling chicha de jora (maize beer), beer, and raising birds among other things. Her business is located in her home. She has requested a loan of 1000 Nuevos Soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy larger quantities of beer to offer her customers and in this way generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of beer to offer to her customers.

loans.name: Hajara

texts.en: Hajara remembers feeling depressed  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before she became a Babban Gona Member. Now,  Hajara, like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Hajara  is ambitious and is aiming to reap up to 35 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs” expressed Hajara. With this loan, Hajara is well on her way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: G.s Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
La señora Ana María de 34 años de edad, vive con su esposo y su hija  en su casa propia se dedica desde hace 5 años al negocio de venta de Plásticos, como pailas, tasas, vasos, pazcones, soperas, etc. vive en una aldea al sur de Honduras, es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Doña Ana María necesita el préstamo para la compra de pailas, tasas, vasos, platos, pazcones, etc. y tener la mercadería necesaria para la venta, espera al igual que sus compañeras de grupo obtener los ingresos necesarios para mejorar su calidad de vida y las de su familia.
Doña María Marcos se dedica al negocio de pulpería desde hace 10 años de dedicarse al negocio.
Doña Digna se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa nueva desde hace 2 años.
Doña Mayra se dedica a la venta de rosquillas, tiene 10 años de dedicarse al negocio de vender rosquillas y le va muy bien. 
El sueño del grupo es crecer con sus negocios y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana María is 34 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in their own home in a village in southern Honduras. For the past five years she has been selling plastic items such as platters, cups, glasses, spatulas, soup bowls, etc. She is an enterprising woman who wants to get ahead and struggles every day to improve her quality of life.

Ana Maria needs the loan so she can buy platters, cups, glasses, plates, spatulas, etc. and have the necessary merchandise for sale. She also hopes that her other group members will have the income necessary to improve their quality of life and that of their families. Maria Marcos has had a grocery store for 10 years; Digna has been selling clothing for 2 years; and Mayra has been selling donuts for 10 years and it is going very well for her.  The group's dream is to grow their businesses and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy platters, cups, glasses, plates, spatulas, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Habila

texts.en: Habila is a 30-year-old farmer from Galadima. As a Babban Gona member, Habila, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Habila can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the national average of 14. However, Habila is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season, as this loan will give him access to inputs such as improved seed. When asked how he plans to spend the money he will make from selling his produce, Habila said “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children: Anoch and Edmond. Ultimately, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Diana Carolina

texts.es:
Diana, vive con su madre y una pequeña hija, es madre soltera; como una forma de tener ingresos para cubrir las necesidades familiares se dedica a vender diferentes tipos de bebidas refrescantes como: gaseosas, jugos y refrescos naturales, el negocio lo administra junto a su madre.
Comprará jugos, gaseosas, boquitas, pan, galletas, especias, azúcar, sal, arroz, aceite, huevos, etc., con esta compra mejorara su negocio ofreciendo más variedad de productos a sus clientes y aumentara sus ganancias que le servirán para cancelar su deuda y cambiar las circunstancias familiares.
Sus objetivos son tener un negocio rentable, brindar a su hija la oportunidad de superarse académicamente y poco a poco remodelar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Diana lives with her mother and small daughter; she is a single mom.  As a way to get an income to cover the family needs, she makes a living selling different types of refreshing drinks like sodas, juices, and natural soft drinks.  She runs her business together with her mother.

She will buy juices, sodas, snacks, bread, cookies, spices, sugar, salt, rice, oil, eggs, etc.  With this purchase, she will improve her business by offering a larger variety of products to her customers and increasing her profit, which serves to settle her debt and change her family circumstances. 

Diana's goals are to have a profitable business, offer her daughter the opportunity to better herself academically, and to slowly remodel their home.

loans.use: to buy juices, sodas, snacks, bread, cookies, spices, sugar, salt, rice, oil, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Baturiya

texts.en: Baturiya is a Babban Gona farmer from Chiroma. Baturiya expressed that he is driven by one goal; to “become the most profitable farmer in my community.” It is the desire to fulfil this ambition that led Baturiya to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Baturiya can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Baturiya, is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 60 bags per hectare this season. By doing so, Baturiya will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what he plans to do with his income from this season, he said: “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland”. With this loan, Baturiya will be able to access all the inputs and services to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income
