loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José Luis tiene 29 años de edad, vive en el distrito de San Nicolas – Zaña, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica al transporte público en su propia mototaxi, transportando a sus clientes en los alrededores de Zaña y anexos, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de repuestos y mantenimiento de su vehículo y de esta manera seguir brindando su servicio.
texts.en:
José Luis is 29 years old and lives in the San Nicolas - Zaña district, a community where people work in agriculture, trade, and livestock, located in the Chiclayo province, which is part of the Lambayeque Region on the north coast of Peru.

He works in public transport using his own 'mototaxi,' transporting his clients in the areas around Zaña. He has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 2000 PEN to buy replacement parts for and to maintain his vehicle, and so continue to offer his services.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts for his vehicle

loans.name: Husaini

texts.en: Husaini is a 35-year-old farmer from Kiyawa.  As a Babban Gona member, Husaini, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist.  Like all Babban Gona members, Husaini can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the national average of 14. However, Husaini is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Husaini said “I plan to use the money I make to educate my child, Mussa, and in 5 years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea is 26 years old. She is a garment worker and a married woman with two children. Her husband is a security guard. They live in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. They can earn approximately $12 per day. 

Now Chea would like to apply for a loan to buy a motor for her husband to run as a motor taxi when her husband is free from his work. This loan will help her husband earn more income for the family. In the future, she is going to open a shop designing clothes, renovate her house and send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy a motor for her husband to run as a motor taxi

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina is aged 63. She is married to a farmer, and blessed with four children. She owns and operates a retail store in their village and earns a net income of 700 PHP (Philippines pesos) daily. Her net income on this business is usually spent on the school allowances of her one son, who's still studying. 

Due to insufficient funds, she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 15,000 to purchase beverages, noodles, sugar, coffee, eggs and cooking oil to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase beverages, noodles, sugar, coffee, eggs and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Gertrudez

texts.en:
Gertrudez is married with two children. She helps her husband operate their own farm to make a living. She has been doing this for many years, earning well to support the needs of her children. 

To improve her farm, she borrowed a new loan to purchase fertilizer. She had joined GDMPC currently, and she gained access to microfinance services of the cooperative. 

In the future, she wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Jose Anibal

texts.es:
José, con ayuda del préstamo anterior amplio el área de cultivo, logro una cosecha más abundante, tiene mejores ganancias y las circunstancias familiares poca a poco están cambiando positivamente.
Opta por un nuevo préstamo para seguir cultivando maíz y frijol, comprara fertilizantes, insecticidas, semilla y abono, espera tener buenos resultados como en el crédito anterior.
texts.en: José, with the help of the previous loan, expanded his cultivation area. He achieved a more abundant harvest and has better earnings. His family circumstances have changed positively little by little. He is opting for a new loan to keep growing corn and beans. He will buy fertilizer, insecticide and seeds. He hopes to have good results like he did with the previous loan.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and seeds.

loans.name: D. Yohana

texts.en: D. Yohana is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. D. Yohana joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his  children: Shitu, Jibo, and  Christopher.. D. Yohana is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, D. Yohana will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, D. Yohana can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and  earn up to $2000/ha: more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make this year, he said, “I plan to use the money  to expand my farmland.” D. Yohana is not thinking about this year alone; he expressed that his long-term goal is to “become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Hoeun

texts.en:
Hoeun is 37 years old. She is a married woman with a child. She buys rice and sugar to resell. She has been in this business since 2005. Her husband and child are construction workers. They all live in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. All of them can earn approximately $16 per day. 

Now Hoeun would like to request a loan to buy piglets to feed and resell. This loan will help her earn more income. In the future, she is going to expand her piglets feeding and renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy piglets to feed and resell

loans.name: Anasitasia

texts.en:
Anasitasia is 40 years old and unmarried with five children. She has a small vegetable garden where she grows cabbages and tomatoes that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for five years. 

Anasitasia needs a loan to buy insect poison, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gloves and a watering hose. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. Anasitasia will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family’s weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy insect poison, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gloves and a watering hose.

loans.name: Virgen De La Puerta Group

texts.es: “VIERGEN DE LA PUERTA” es un grupo conformado por socios empeñosos en mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias. sarella tiene 29 años de edad es conviviente con 02 hijos educando. ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza hace 1 años y a la vez trabaja en para una empresa como operaria. El credito lo invertira en la compra de mas productos que esten en oferta para expenderlos a un precio que le de ganancias. el grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA  por el credito brindado. sarella es la tercera del lado derecho.
texts.en: “VIRGEN DE LA PUERTA” is a group made up of hardworking members who want to improve their families' quality of life. Sarella is 29 years old, in a common law marriage and is raising 2 children. She has sold beauty products for a year and she also works as a laborer for a business. She will invest the loan in buying more products that are on sale so that she can sell them at a price that will bring in profit. The group thanks the Kiva investors for the loan.   Sarella is third from the right.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products.

loans.name: Las Margaritas Group

texts.es: Lidivina de 49 años de edad es soltera. Este es el grupo “Las Margaritas” está constituida por 06 socias emprendedoras y entusiastas. Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, actualmente continua creciendo su negocio con la venta de bebidas. El deseo de Lidivina es llegar a más clientes debido a la gran demanda. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de gaseosa, agua mineral y bebidas re hidratantes. El grupo “Las Margaritas” agradece a los inversionistas Kiva que facilitaron dicho crédito. Lidivina es la segunda del lado izquierdo y viste casaca morado.
texts.en: Lidivina is 49 years old. She is single. This is the “Las Margaritas” group. It is made up of 6 enterprising and enthusiastic members. She sells groceries and right now she is growing her business by selling beverages. Lidivina wants to serve more customers due to the high demand. She asked for the loan to buy sodas, mineral water, and re-hydrating beverages. The “Las Margaritas” group thanks the Kiva investors who are making the loan possible. Lidivina is the second from the left and is wearing a purple jacket.

loans.use: to buy sodas, mineral water and re-hydrating beverages.

loans.name: 01 - Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Huệ operates a food stall selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish to resell. Huệ has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Huệ faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Huệ is 44 years old, and she is married with two children. Huệ is the group leader of the 01 - Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of eight members. Huệ lives with two dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2009, Huệ joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Huệ has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Huệ hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase fish to resell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a 60-year-old farmer from Lado.  As a Babban Gona member, Esther is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets, and a trained agronomist.  Like all Babban Gona members, Esther can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Esther is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Esther said “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children: Simon, Salama, and Husaina,and in 5 years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs." With this loan, she is well on her way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann has been selling various kinds of fish. She is 31 years old and married with three children. Two of her children are still attending school, while her youngest child is infant-aged. Her husband works as a fisherman within her village.

The couple would like to keep her fish vending business profitable. To realize this, she is seeking a loan of PHP 17,000, allowing her to purchase various kinds of fish, such as flying fish, cadiz, tangi and yellowfin fish. She believes that through her requested loan amount, she could develop her fish vending and get ahead in life.

Mary Ann is looking forward for approval of her requested loan amount.

loans.use: to buy various kinds of fish to sell.

loans.name: Ayuba

texts.en: Ayuba G. is a Babban Gona farmer from Chiroma. Ayuba G. expressed that he is driven by one goal; to “become the most profitable farmer in my community.” It is the desire to fulfil this ambition that led Ayuba G. to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Ayuba G. can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Ayuba G., is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 60 bags per hectare this season. By doing so, Ayuba G. will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what he plans to do with his income from this season, he said: “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland”. With this loan, Ayuba G. will be able to access all the inputs and services to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Habu

texts.en: Habu is a 38-year-old farmer from Chiroma.  As a Babban Gona member, Habu, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist.  Like all Babban Gona members, Habu can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Habu is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Habu said “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children: Ezekiel, Joseph,and Caleb, and in 5 years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Yosiya

texts.en: Yosiya is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Yosiya joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children . Yosiya is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Yosiya will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products like sand. With access to high quality inputs, Yosiya can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14  and  earn up to $2000/ha, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked, Yosiya said “I plan to use the money I make this year to expand my farmland.” Yosiya is not thinking about just this year; he said “in 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community.”

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Sokmuoy

texts.en:
Sokmuoy is 40 years old and a married woman with two children. She lives in Prey Chhor District of Kampong Cham Province. In the last 20 years, she and her husband have been involved in a rice farming business, growing rice and selling it to the local dealers. It is the sole source of their income. Her family’s daily income is USD $5.

Sokmuoy wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine and buy its facilities. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL, with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is aged 48. She is married to a tricycle driver and blessed with two children. She has managed a retail store in their village for almost 10 years and earns a net income of 3,500 PHP (Philippines pesos) every hog. Her net income is usually spent on their daily expenses. 

Due to insufficient funds, she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 40,000 to purchase hog feeds and two hogs to raise. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow and become more productive.

loans.use: To purchase hog feeds and two hogs to raise.

loans.name: Pereseti

texts.en:
Pereseti is 32 years old and married with three children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for five years. 

Pereseti needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gum boots and a spade. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. Pereseti will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gum boots and a spade

loans.name: Ibrahim G.

texts.en: Ibrahim G. is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Ibrahim G. joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children.  Ibrahim G. is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Ibrahim G. will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products like sand. With access to high quality inputs, Ibrahim G. can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14  and  earn up to $2000/ha, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked, Ibrahim G. said “I plan to use the money I make this year to build a better home.” Ibrahim G. is not thinking about just this year; he said in 5 years, he wants to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a Babban Gona farmer from Chiroma. Ali expressed that he is driven by one goal; to “become the most profitable farmer in my community.” It is the desire to fulfil this ambition that led Ali to join Babban Gona. By doing so, Ali will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what he plans to do with his income from this season, he said: “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland”. With this loan, Ali will be able to access all the inputs and services to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Shitu

texts.en: Shitu is a Babban Gona farmer from Dorayi. Shitu expressed that he is driven by one goal: to “ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs.” It is the desire to fulfil this ambition that led Shitu to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Shitu can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Shitu is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 67 bags per hectare this season. By doing so, Shitu will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what he plans to do with his income from this season, he said: “I plan to use the money I make to build a better home.” With this loan, Shitu will be able to access all the inputs and services to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Cada fin de semana, un olor exquisito a Nacatamal se desprende de la humilde casa de doña Maribel, no hay persona que se resista a comprar uno de los platillos típicos que esta señora prepara con mucho esmero y dedicación; de igual manera prepara enchiladas, las que vende todas las tardes en la acera de su casa. Tiene 64 años, está casada y tiene siete hijos, todos mayores e independientes. Hace 30 años se dedica a la venta de comida, su primera actividad comercial fue laborar en una panadería, con la que logró sacar adelante a todos sus hijos. Ella se muestra agradecida por el apoyo de toda la familia.
Doña Maribel solicita el crédito para incrementar la producción de su negocio, requiere comprar maíz, principal materia prima con la que realiza su comida, de igual manera, carne, pollo, verduras, condimentos, entre otros.  Es una mujer amable, soñadora y emprendedora. Deposita su confianza en el financiamiento, puesto que anhela seguir creciendo en el negocio, ganar más clientela para obtener mejores ingresos, de manera que pueda seguir colaborando en la economía familiar, razón por la que día a día lucha.
texts.en:
Every weekend, an exquisite smell of nacatamal (Nicaraguan tamale) rises from Maribel's humble home. There's no one who can resist buying one of the typical dishes she prepares with care and dedication. She makes enchiladas with equal care, and sells them every afternoon on the sidewalk by her house. She is 64 years old, married, and has seven children, all of age and independent. She has worked selling food for 30 years: her first job was working in a bakery, with which she was able to take care of all her children. She shows gratitude for the support of her whole family. 

Maribel is requesting this loan to increase the production of her business. She needs to buy corn, the main ingredient that she uses to prepare her foods, along with meat, chicken, vegetables, condiments, and other ingredients. She is a friendly, smiling, and enterprising woman. She places her trust in this loan, as she longs to continue growing her business and get more customers, to make a better income, so she can continue to contribute to the family finances, which is her reason for fighting day in and day out.

loans.use: to buy corn, the main ingredient that she uses to prepare her foods, along with meat, chicken, vegetables, condiments, and others.

loans.name: Saly

texts.en:
Saly is 52 years old, widowed, and has five children. Two of her children are singers, one is a worker, one is a soldier, and one attends school. They all live in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. All of them can earn approximately $20 per day. 

Saly sells porridge, fruit, and sweets, which she has been doing since 2008. She requested for a loan, which she will use to buy cows for her children to feed and breed for calves to resell. This loan will help them earn more income. In the future, Saly plans to expand cow feeding and support her youngest child to go to university.

loans.use: to purchase cows for her children to feed

loans.name: Mi Cajero Group

texts.es: El grupo “MI CAJERO”  está conformada por socios dedicados al comercio minorista. Nancy tiene 55 años de edad es casada con 03 hijos independientes. Ella se dedica  a la venta de postres en su comunidad. El crédito lo invertirá e la compra de mas insumos para elaborar sus postres. Su mayor deseo es tener un buen ingreso económico para su familia. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Nancy es la segunda del lado derecho.
texts.en:
The “MI CAJERO” group is made up of members who run retail businesses. 

Nancy is 55 years old, married, and has 3 independent children. She sells desserts in her community. She will use this loan to buy more ingredients to make her desserts. Her wish is to have a good income for her family. 

The group thanks Kiva investors for the loan offered. Nancy is second from the right in the photo.

loans.use: to buy ingredients used to make desserts.

loans.name: Pisey

texts.en:
Pisey (in the photo), age 21, is single and lives with her parents and sisters and brothers in a suburb of Phnom Penh. His parents’ business is in selling motorcycle spare parts.  

Pisey is now a third-year student of Medical University in Phnom Penh, majoring in nursing. She hopes she will have a professional skill to work for a hospital or private clinic. 

Pisey hopes to continue her studies, so she decided to apply for a loan in order to pay her school fee.

loans.use: To pay her school fee.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 26-year-old woman who is married with one child. She runs a small tailoring business in her community. She has five years of experience with this business. Mary has requested a loan to buy a new sewing machine, thread, needles, a measuring tape, a new pair of scissors and material. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, thread, needles, a measuring tape, a new pair of scissors and material

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a Babban Gona farmer from Chiroma. Peter expressed that he is driven by one goal; to “become the most profitable farmer in my community.” It is the desire to fulfil this ambition that led Peter to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Peter can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Peter, is ambitious and is aiming to reap close to 35 bags per hectare this season. By doing so, Peter will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what he plans to do with his income from this season, he said: “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland”. With this loan, Peter will be able to access all the inputs and services to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
En el interior una institución privada, los muebles y oficinas lucen muy limpias y brillantes, el piso reluce la imagen de los visitantes.  Todo esto gracias a la dedicación de una mujer llamada Cecilia de 46 años y casada, quien es la encargada de servicios de limpieza de dicha institución desde hace dos años.

Además que tiene una venta de refacciones los días sábados en su casa ubicada en el departamento de Sololá, donde vive con una hermosa familia compuesta por 4 hijos varones y una mujer de 14 años quien estudia la secundaria.

Ya en su casa, doña Cecilia también le preocupa, además de mantenerla limpia pero también cree que se vería más hermosa si pudiera remodelarla para que sus hijos puedan vivir más cómodamente y más felices.

Es por eso que ella está solicitando un préstamos para poder realizar ese sueño de comodidad de hogar que merecen sus hijos.
texts.en:
Inside a private business, the furniture and offices shine, brilliantly clean; the floor reflects the image of the visitors. All of this is thanks to the dedication of a woman called Cecilia, 46 years old and married, who has been in charge of the cleaning services of this business for two years.

She also has a business selling replacement parts on Saturdays out of her house, located in the Sololá department, where she lives with a beautiful family of four sons and one young woman, 14 years old, who is in secondary school.

Even in her own house, Cecilia still takes care. She keeps it clean but she also thinks that it would look more beautiful if it could be remodeled, so that her children could live more comfortably and happily.

This is why she is requesting a loan to be able to bring about her dream of the comfortable home that her children deserve.

loans.use: to remodel her house

loans.name: Ivan Alexander

texts.es:
Ivan Alexander tiene 31 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Zaña, una comunidad de clima variado, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica al transporte público mediante su mototaxi y a brindar servicios de construcción civil, es un padre emprendedor, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de repuestos y aceites para su vehículo y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Ivan Alexander is 31 years old and lives in the district of Zaña, a community with a varied climate. It’s population’s main industries are agriculture, livestock, and trade. It is located in the province of Chiclayo, which belongs to the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru. 
Iván Alexander makes his living in public transport with his motorcycle taxi,  and he also works in construction. He is an entrepreneurial father and has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 1,000 nuevos soles to buy spare parts and oil for his vehicle so he can earn more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his vehicle.

loans.name: Balarebe

texts.en: Balarebe is a 70-year-old farmer from Kiyawa.  As a Babban Gona member, Balarebe, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Balarebe can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Balarebe is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, he will be able to acces quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will  result in a yield of at least 40 bags of maize per hectare this season.  Balarebe is hopeful about what the future holds; he  hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, he will finally be able to afford to educate his children; Yusuf,  and  Mansur,. Balarebe’s dreams do not end here: “ultimately, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”, he expressed.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Alhaji Dayyabu

texts.en: Alhaji Dayyabu is a Babban Gona farmer from Dorayi. Alhaji Dayyabu expressed that he is driven by one goal: to “ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs.” It is the desire to fulfil this ambition that led Alhaji Dayyabu to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Alhaji Dayyabu can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Alhaji Dayyabu is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 45 bags per hectare this season. By doing so, Alhaji Dayyabu will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what he plans to do with his income from this season, he said: “I plan to use the money I make to build a better home.” With this loan, Alhaji Dayyabu will be able to access all the inputs and services to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Carmen Lilian

texts.es:
Carmen, vive con sus dos hijos de 20 y 15 años de edad, sus esfuerzos son enfocados en seguir trabajando para salir adelante con su familia; su negocio es la venta de hog dogs, panes con pollo, jugos gaseosas, licuados, entre otros antojitos, trabaja todo los días sin horario establecido.
Utilizará el capital para comprar pan, repollo, tomates, cebollas, condimentos, pollo, embutidos, gaseosas, jugos, leche azúcar, guineos, fresas, gas propano entre otros materiales para preparar la venta, espera mejorar la calidad del producto y su situación económica.
Sus sueños son tener un negocio más popular y con mayor rentabilidad.
texts.en:
Carmen lives with her two sons aged 15 and 20 years old. Her efforts are focused on continuing to work to get ahead with her family. Her business is the sale of hot dogs, chicken sandwiches, juices, soft drinks, smoothies amongst other snacks. She works daily with no set schedule.

She will use the loan to buy bread, cabbage, tomatoes, onion, condiments, chicken, sausages, soft drinks, juices, milk, sugar, bananas, strawberries, propane, etc. to prepare her sales. She hopes to improve the quality of her product and her economic situation. Her dreams are to have a more popular and more profitable business.

loans.use: to buy bread, cabbage, tomatoes, onion, spices, chicken, sausages, soft drinks, juices, milk, sugar, bananas, strawberries, propane, etc.

loans.name: Bruno

texts.es:
Bruno, vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 33 y 32 años de edad, todos viven juntos; de manera personal ha emprendido su negocio que es atender una panadería, una granja de pollo de engorde y compra de reces para el destazo que luego vende toda la carne, su negocio está funcionado desde hace 7 años, trabaja con sus hijos y un empleado.
Invertirá en la compra de manteca, levadura, huevos, leche, harina, concentrado para pollos y pagara el mantenimiento de su equipo de trabajo, teniendo a su alcance la materia prima para elaborar sus productos y en buen estado su equipo de trabajo agilizará y aumentara la producción para lograr abastecer a sus clientes, espera que sus ingresos mejoren y no enfrentar dificultades en cancelar su deuda.
Sus anhelos son terminar de pagar su casa nueva, equipar mejor su negocio y comprara un nuevo vehículo para desplazar sus productos.
texts.en:
Bruno lives with his wife and two children, ages 33 and 32. They all live together. He began his business himself, which is running a bakery, a chicken fattening farm, and the purchase of cows for butchering and selling all the meat. He has been in business for seven years, and he works with his children and with an employee.

He will invest in the purchase of shortening, raising agent, eggs, milk, flour, concentrated chicken feed, and in paying for the maintenance of his equipment. Having at hand the materials to make his products and having his equipment in good condition facilitates and increases his production so that he can supply his clients' needs. He hopes that his income will increase and that he will not encounter difficulties in paying his debt.

His desires are to finish paying for his new house, to outfit his business better, and to buy a new vehicle to transport his products.

loans.use: to buy shortening, raising agent, eggs, milk, flour, concentrated chicken feed and to pay for maintenance of his equipment

loans.name: Samaila

texts.en: Samaila is a Babban Gona farmer from Kiyawa. Samaila expressed that he is driven by one goal; to “become the most profitable farmer in my community.” It is the desire to fulfil this ambition that led Samaila to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Samaila can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Samaila, is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 40 bags per hectare this season. By doing so, Samaila will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what he plans to do with his income from this season, he said: “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland”. With this loan, Samaila will be able to access all the inputs and services to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa, con ayuda del préstamo anterior mejoro su negocio de venta de tortillas, ha cambiado las circunstancias familiares,  cancelado sus deudas e iniciado a vender pupusas.
Solicita un nuevo préstamo para comprar maíz, leña, cal, gas propano, harina, aceite, aderezos, tomates, verduras, bebidas, quesillo, chicharrón etc., para elaborar la venta de tortillas y pupusas, de esta manera seguirá teniendo un negocio más competitivo y generando ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Rosa with the help of the last loan improved her business selling tortillas. She has changed her family's circumstances, paid off her debt and started to sell pupusas. She is requesting a new loan to buy corn, wood, lime, flour, oil, seasonings, tomatoes, vegetables, drinks, cheese, pork cracklings, etc. to prepare for the sale of tortillas and pupusas. In this way she will continue to have a more competitive business and generate economic revenue.

loans.use: to buy corn, wood, lime, flour, oil, seasonings, tomatoes, vegetables, drinks, cheese, pork cracklings, etc.

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Sophea (in photo), age 22, is single. She lives with her parents and brother on an island of the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Her mother is a weaver and her father works for commune office.
 
Sophea is a fourth year student, majoring in banking at a university in Phnom Penh. This is the last year of her bachelor degree as well as graduation! Hence, she requests a loan in order to pay for her school fee.

loans.use: To pay for her school fee.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and a stock of ice creams.

loans.name: Dizahab Eliazim

texts.es:
Muchas veces el don natural a la dedicación al trabajo viene tomado de la mano de agotamientos físicos que se traduce en una salud deteriorada que impide el desarrollo y desenvolvimiento laboral normal.

Esta es la situación actual de Dizahab, de 31 años y soltero, dedicado a su trabajo como coordinador en una organización que dedica a programas de protección a la tala de árboles en Sololá.

Dizahab tiene dos hijos, un varoncito de cinco años quien está empezando sus estudios primarios, y una hermosa niña de dos años.

Dizahab solicita un préstamo para gastos médicos para utilizarlos en una operación quirúrgica para el mejoramiento de su salud y así retomar su responsabilidad de cuidar la naturaleza, herencia ambiental del futuro de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Often the natural gift for dedication to work comes hand in hand with physical debilitation that translate into a deteriorating health which impedes normal work development and growth. 

This is the current situation of Dizahab, who is 31 years old, single, and dedicated to his work as a coordinator in an organization for programs to protect the trees in Sololá from logging.

Dizahab has two children, a little boy of five who is starting primary school, and a beautiful two-year-old girl.


Dizahab is requesting a loan for medical expenses, to use on a surgical operation to improve his health and reassume his responsibility to care for the natural world, the environmental legacy of his children's future.

loans.use: to pay medical expenses for a surgical operation

loans.name: Mamuda

texts.en: Mamuda is a Babban Gona farmer from Ang/Zarto. Mamuda is driven by one goal: to “become the most profitable farmer in my community.” It is this ambition that led Mamuda to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Mamuda can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Mamuda is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 40 bags per hectare this season because with this loan, he will finally be able to access the required yield enhancing inputs such as improved seeds. Mamuda is hoping that as a result of this expected yield, he will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what changes he would like to make, he said “I plan to use the money I make to provide more food and clothing for my family.  Ultimately, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community.” With this loan, Mamuda will be able to access all the inputs and services to make these dreams reality.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Elmira

texts.ru:
Эльмира живет в маленьком районе Б.Гафурова города Худжанд. Она по профессии парикмахер-стилист и зарабатывет этим на жизнь. Эльмире 36 лет. Она замужем и воспитывает двоих сыновей. На протяжении 3 лет Эльмира работает в салоне красоты. Она предоставляет такие услуги как стрижка, окрашивание, мелирование волос и т.д. Эльмира относится к своему делу с любовью и поэтому ее клиенты всегда довольны ее услугой. 
Эльмира сейчас хочет улучшить бытовые условия в своем доме. Ее холодильник и телевизор устарели и не работают должным образом, поэтому она хочет обновить их. И еще из-за невыносимой жары ей необходимо купить в дом кондиционер. Для совершения этих покупок, Эльмира обратилась за кредитом. Она будет очень признательна за поддержку и обещает выплачивать кредит в срок за счет своей деятельности.
texts.en:
Elmira lives in the tiny B. Gafurov District in the city of Khujand. She is a hairdresser by profession and makes a living doing this. Elmira is 36 years old. She is married and is raising two sons. For the past three years, Elmira has been working in a beauty salon. She offers such services as haircutting, hair dying, highlighting, etc. Elmira approaches her job with love which is why her clients are always satisfied with her services.

Elmira now wants to improve the living conditions in her home. Her refrigerator and television have become outdated and don't work properly, which is why she wants to upgrade them. Also, due to intolerable heat, she needs to buy an air conditioner for her house. Elmira took out a loan to complete this purchase. She will be grateful for the support and promises to pay back the loan on time using revenue from her business.

loans.use: to buy an air conditioner, a refrigerator and a television to improve the living conditions in her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase hair dyes

loans.name: Angelo

texts.en: Angelo is taking up Computer Programming. Though sometimes he has difficulty in his monthly exams, he will endure them because he wants to finish college to help his family and to have a bright future. Angelo hopes that Kiva lenders will approve his loan request of 10,000 PHP for him to pay for his tuition fee.

loans.use: To pay for his tuition fee.

loans.name: Sokhey

texts.en:
From Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province, Sokhey, 23, is a tailor in a private garment factory which is located so far from her house. So far, she has been in this career for five years and the average income that she can make is 4 USD a day. At home, she is a mother of one son who is attending a kindergarten school in the village.

The distance from her house to the garment factory is so far and she normally uses a bicycle, but it is very time and energy consuming. Now she would like to get a Kiva loan via KHL to buy a motorbike to use as a main vehicle in her family. With the support from this loan, she hopes that she can save her time and energy in traveling to her workplace. She also thanks all the lenders for their generous behaviors.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Saratu

texts.en: Saratu is a Babban Gona farmer from Chiroma. Saratu expressed that she is driven by one goal; to “become the most profitable farmer in my community.” It is the desire to fulfil this ambition that led Saratu to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, she finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Saratu can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Saratu, is ambitious and is aiming to reap a total of 30 bags on her 0.30 ha farm. By doing so, Saratu will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what she plans to do with her income from this season, she said: “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland.” With this loan, Saratu will be able to access all the inputs and services to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to start her business making and selling cheeses.

loans.name: Sadiku

texts.en: Sadiku is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Sadiku joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Sadiku is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Sadiku will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would  be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive, but are often diluted with external products like sand. With access to high quality inputs, Sadiku can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14  and  earn up to $2000/ha, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked, Sadiku said “I plan to use the money I make this year to provide more food and clothing for my family. Sadiku is not thinking about just this year; he said, “in 5 years, I want to become the  most profitable farmer in my community.”

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Alofa

texts.en:
Alofa is 34 years old and unwed with two children. 

She has a small vegetable garden where she grows cabbages and tomatoes that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. 

Alofa needs a loan to buy insect poison, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gloves and a watering hose. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Alofa will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy insect poison, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gloves and a watering hose

loans.name: Nozigul

texts.ru: Нозигул жизнерадостная и трудолюбивая женщина. Она работает в государственном учреждении техничкой. Нозигул работает более 14 лет. Она является одной из трудолюбивых работников и выполняет свою работу качественно. Она еще имеет  медицинское образование и предоставляет услуги медсестры местным жителям. Она справляется одна со всеми семейными расходами, так как ее муж пенсионер. Нозигул хочет отремонтировать свой дом. Ее дом в плохом состоянии. Однако она не имеет достаточно денег для этого. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 900 долларов США для покупки строительный материалов как цемент, краски и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Nozigul is a cheerful and hardworking woman. She works in a state technical institute. Nozigul has worked there for more than 14 years. She is one of the hardest working employees and does all of her work well. She also has a medical education and offers her nursing services to local residents. She copes with all of the family's expenses by herself, as her husband is retired. Nozigul wants to renovate her house. Her house is in bad condition. However, she does not have enough money to make repairs. She is requesting a loan for 900 USD to buy building materials like cement, paint, etc. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to buy building materials to repair her house.

loans.name: Nuhu

texts.en: Nuhu is a 40-year-old farmer from Ang/Zarto.  As a Babban Gona member, Nuhu is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Nuhu can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Nuhu is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, he will be able to access quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will  result in a yield of at least 40 bags of maize per hectare this season.  Nuhu is hopeful about what the future holds; he  hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, he will finally be able to afford to educate his children; Sahabi,  and Zulai. Nuhu’s dreams do not end there: “ultimately, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community”, he expressed.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Alh. Kasimu

texts.en: Alh. Kasimu is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Alh. Kasimu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Tsalha, Danazumi, and Adam. Alh. Kasimu is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Alh. Kasimu will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would  be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive, but are often diluted with external products like sand. With access to high quality inputs, Alh. Kasimu can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14  and  earn up to $2000/ha, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked, Alh. Kasimu said “I plan to use the money I make this year to provide more food and clothing for my family. Alh. Kasimu is not thinking about just this year; he said, “in 5 years, I want to become the  most profitable farmer in my community.”

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Alh. Sagiru

texts.en: Alh. Sagiru is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Alh. Sagiru joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children; Ali, Abubakar,  and  Nasiru. Alh. Sagiru is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Alh.Sagiru will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive, but are often diluted with external products like sand. With access to high quality inputs, Alh.Sagiru can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14  and  earn up to $2000/ha, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked, Alh. Sagiru said “I plan to use the money I make this year to expand my farmland." Alh. Sagiru is not thinking about just this year; he said, in 5 years, he wants to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Kabiru

texts.en: Kabiru is a 50-year-old farmer from Tafida.  As a Babban Gona member, Kabiru is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Kabiru can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the national average of 14. However, Kabiru is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make as a Babban Gona member, she said, “I plan to use the money  to educate my children; Mubarak, Jibrin, and  Sdhabi. My overall goal is to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving these goals.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a blender, table and ingredients for his bakery.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a knitting machine.

loans.name: Mavlakat

texts.ru: Мавлакат родилась в 1961 году. Она вдова и имеет 3 детей. Мавлакат пережила много трудностей. В 2012 году ее муж и сын были убиты. Она работает в учебном центре. Мавлакат там преподает. Она любит свою работу и работает уже несколько лет. Мавлакат живет вместе с 3 детьми в старой квартире. Она должна сделать капитальный ремонт в своей квартире и с такой целью она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, краски, обои и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Mavlakat was born in 1961. She is a widow and has three children. Mavlakat has survived many difficulties. In 2012, her husband and son were killed. She works in a training center. Mavlakat teaches there. She loves her job and has worked there for several years already. Mavlakat lives with her three children in an old apartment. She needs to make major repairs to her apartment which is why she is requesting a loan. She is requesting a loan for 3000 somoni to buy construction materials such as cement, paint, wallpaper, etc. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as cement, paint and wall-paper to repair her house.

loans.name: Haidee

texts.en:
Haidee, settled and living in San Vicente, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur, Philippines. Haidee owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting rice. She earns a better income from this, and she was able to sustain their living. 

Her previous loan, used for farming, was successfully repaid. She had to ensure the improvement of her farm to ensure a better source of income for the family in the future. 

She took a new loan recently to buy fertilizer.

In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and to the family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

location.town: San Vicente, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn has been engaged in selling fish, specifically tanguingue and talakitok, for 30 years. She is married and has six children. Currently, two of her children attend school, one is a fisherman, and three are married. With the large number of household size she has, she doubled her time working hard to earn better profits. Now she has been doing her very best to earn a living.

Marilyn wants to increase her generated income, so she is seeking financial assistance amounting to PHP 17,000 to buy 300 kilograms of talakitok and tanguigue fish to sell within her village. She knows that this amount of loan has a great impact on achieving her goals in business and life.

She hopes to have continuous growth of her fish vending business. In this way she could uplift their living conditions and let her two children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy 300 kilograms of talakitok and tanguigue fish

loans.name: Jose Edmundo

texts.es:
José, se dedica a cultivar plantas de café y hortalizas que luego vende a las fincas, ya cuenta con 20 años de experiencia, para desempeñar estas actividades su preparación ha sido académica; don José es casado, en su hogar hay tres hijos que están estudiando, todos dependen económicamente de él.
Lo servirá para comprar tierra negra, semilla mejorada, bolsas y otros materiales que faciliten su trabajo,  mejoren su producción y tener más variedad de plantas, espera atraer nuevos clientes, estabilizar su situación económica para dar a su familia lo necesario y cubrir la deuda adquirida.
Su visión es ampliar el área de cultivo, mantener su negocio activo y tener mejores recursos económicos.
texts.en:
José works growing coffee plants and vegetables which he then sells at plantations. He has 20 years of experience in this line of work. His preparation was academic. Don José is married and has three children who are in school who all depend on him economically.

He will use the loan to buy top soil, better seed, bags and other materials that facilitate his work. This will improve his production and he will have a wider variety of plants. He hopes to attract new customers, to stabilise his economic situation in order to give his family what they need, and to cover the acquired debt. His vision is to expand his planting area, keep his business active and have better economic resources.

loans.use: buy top soil, better seed, bags and other materials.

loans.name: Jafaru

texts.en: Jafaru is a farmer from Magajin Gari.  As a Babban Gona member, Jafaru is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Jafaru can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Jafaru is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, he will be able to acces quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will result in yields higher than both the national and Babban Gona averages. Jafaru is hopeful about what the future holds; he  hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, he will finally be able to afford to educate his children Shamsu, Maryam, and Zainab. Jafaru’s dreams do not end here,“I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs” he said.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: And Soukhaly Ndiakahté Group

texts.fr:
And Soukhaly Ndiakahté est le nom donné à un groupe de crédit composé d’hommes qui s’activent dans l’agriculture depuis leur jeune âge. 
Mbaye qui se trouve à droite de la photo, est le responsable, il est marié et père de famille. Il vient solliciter un crédit qui lui permettra de s’équiper en matériaux agricoles comme la batteuse, la moissonneuse, d’acheter un cheval. Le crédit leur permettra aussi d’acheter des semences, de l’engrais et des pesticides et exploiter normalement son champ et en récolter le maximum de fruits.
Mbaye est mariée à une dame très brave qui essaie toujours de s’activer dans quelque chose, c’est pourquoi Mbaye a comme ambition de lui construire un poulailler pour qu’elle fasse l’aviculture.
texts.en: The And Soukhaly Ndiakahté Group is made up of male members who have been working in agriculture from a young age. Mbaye, the man to the right of the photo, is the group representative. He is a married father. He is requesting a loan which will allow him to purchase farming materials, such as a thresher, a harvester and a horse. This loan will also allow them to purchase seeds, fertiliser and pesticides, which will allow them to exploit their land and harvest the largest possible fruit yield. Mbaye is married to a good woman who always tries to earn money however she can. This is why Mbaye wants to build her a chicken coop, so that she can start raising chickens.

loans.use: to purchase farming equipment: a harvester and threshing machine, as well as seeds and fertiliser

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en:
From Prey Chhor District in Kampong Cham Province, Chhun is forty-four. She is an experienced and industrious farmer. She is a lovely mother of four dependent children who are enrolled in the local school. By operating a farming business on a small rice field, she can earn around 4 USD a day to support her family's daily expenses. So far, Chhun has been involved in this career for nearly twenty years.

To keep her rice growing well, Chhun is going to use natural fertilizers on her farmland. Due to the shortage of money, she would like to get a Kiva loan via KHL to buy fertilizer to use this farming season. She thanks all the lenders for their generous behavior.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora María del Carmen   de 61  años de edad es casada vive con su esposo, no tiene  hijos  que dependen de ella y vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras.
Doña María del Carmen tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 7  años  a la venta de golosinas y ropa su actividad la realiza en su casa y también de forma ambulante, sus clientes son los amigos, personas que la conocen y los que pasan por su casa.
Doña María es una mujer trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante, está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de harina, huevos, leña, plátanos, tortillas, etc. está muy contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma y con las ganancias que obtenga por sus ventas espera mejorar su bienestar ya que tiene varios proyectos para este año, su sueño es mejorar su casa.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Julio del 2014.
texts.en:
María del Carmen is 61 years old, married and lives with her husband. She has no children who depend on her. She lives in the community of San Lorenzo, a valley in the south of Honduras. María del Carmen has her own house and for the past seven years has worked selling sweets and clothing from her house and in the streets. Her clients are friends, acquaintances and people passing by her house. María is a hard-working woman who wants to get ahead.

She is requesting a loan to buy flour, eggs, wood, bananas, tortillas etc. She is very happy to continue to work with Prisma and with the profits that she gets from her sales she hopes to improve her well-being. She has a variety of projects for this year. She dreams of improving her house. San Lorenzo, Honduras - July 2014.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, wood, bananas, tortillas etc for her business.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en: Marcela is fifty-eight and married to a government employee. They're blessed with two children. She has managed a hog raising business in their village for almost eight years and earns a net income of PHP 3,000 per hog. Due to insufficient funds, she would like to take a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase hogs to raise and a supply of hog feed. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase hogs and hog feed.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is married with two children, and settled for a living at Lanao del Norte. He is a farmer, and has been working on their farm for many long years. 

Their land was pawned by his parents when they had very important needs many years ago. 

Henry joined GDMPC this year and availed a loan to redeem (buy back) his farm. He is happy that this time their farm is fully in their hands, and was thankful to GDMPC for making this happen.

loans.use: to redeem his farm

loans.name: Usman

texts.en: Usman is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Usman joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children Halima, Ummalkairi, and Kabiru. Usman is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Usman will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products like sand. With access to high quality inputs, Usman can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and earn up to $2000/ha, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked, Usman said “I plan to use the money I make this year to provide more food and clothing for my family. Usman is not thinking about just this year; he said in 5 years, he wants to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs.”

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Channy's Group

texts.en:
Channy, 35, is married and has no children. The couple lives in a rural area of Presh Vihea province where electricity is limited. They make money by doing rice farming. In addition, they also raise animals like pigs and chickens. 

To help the environment, Channy is acting as a leader of a group of three female members to apply for loans from VisionFund. Each of them will use their own portion to buy solar lighting for their home.

loans.use: To buy solar lighting

location.town: Preah Vihear Province, Chaom Ksan District

loans.name: Isah

texts.en: Isah remembers not being able to feed or clothe his family during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona member. Now, Isah, like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Isah is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”,  expressed Isah. With this loan, Isah is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Elisha G

texts.en: Elisha G. is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Elisha G. joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his  children: Peter, John, and  Bilya. Elisha G. is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Elisha G. will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Elisha G. can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and  earn up to $2000/ha: more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make this year  as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money  to expand my farmland.” Elisha G. is not thinking about this year alone; he expressed that his longterm goal is to “become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Safiyanu

texts.en: Safiyanu is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Safiyanu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his  children: Mustapha, Musa, and  Fati,. Safiyanu is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Safiyanu will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Safiyanu can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and  earn up to $2000/ha: more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make this year  as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money  to build a better home.” Safiyanu is not thinking about this year alone; he expressed that his longterm goal is to “ensure other members of my community are lifted out of poverty”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Saybiby

texts.ru: Сайбиби вместе со своей семьей живет в квартире, в столице Таджикистана. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Она работает в государственном учреждении уборщицей. Сайбиби в этой позиции работает уже много лет. Она получает не большую зарплату и поэтому она не может сделать ремонт квартиры. Сайбиби запрашивает займ на сумму 600 долларов США для покупки строительных материалов как краски, обои и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Saybiby and her family live in an apartment in the capital of Tajikistan. She is married and is raising two children. She works in a government agency as a cleaning woman. Saybiby has worked in this position for many years. She earns a small salary which is why she has been unable to make repairs on her apartment. Saybiby is requesting a loan for 600 USD to buy building materials such as paint, wallpaper, etc. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as paint and wall-paper for repairing her apartment.

loans.name: Garba

texts.en: Garba is a Babban Gona farmer from Chiroma. Garba is driven by one goal: to “ensure other members of my community are lifted out of poverty.” It is this ambition that led Garba to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Garba can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Garba is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 35 bags per hectare this season because with this loan, he will finally be able to access the required yield enhancing inputs such as improved seeds. Garba is hoping that as a result of this expected yield, he will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what changes he would like to make, he said “I plan to use the money I make to build a better home. Ultimately, I want to ensure other members of my community are lifted out of poverty.” With this loan, Garba will be able to access all the inputs and services to make these dreams reality.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Jeonil

texts.en: Jeonil is from Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur in the Philippines. He is thirty-four years old and has three children. For the past thirteen years of married life, he has been raising pigs and selling them in town for a living. He earns a good income from this in addition to farming. He wants to improve his pig business by building a pig pen. He has taken a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase feeding supplies. He wants to improve his business as well as the general living standards of his family.

loans.use: to purchase feeding supplies

loans.name: Basiru

texts.en: Basiru is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Basiru joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his  children: Muhammad, Habiba, and  Abdulhakim,. Basiru is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Basiru will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Basiru can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and  earn up to $2000/ha: more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.
