With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Yakubu

texts.en: Yakubu is a farmer from Pegi. As a Babban Gona member, Yakubu is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Yakubu can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Yakubu is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 per hectare this season. When asked, Yakubu said “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland and in 5 years, I want to make more money for myself and my family.” With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Ado G.

texts.en: Ado G. is a Babban Gona farmer from Chiroma. Ado G. is driven by one goal: to “become the most profitable farmer in my community.” It is this ambition that led Ado G. to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Ado G. can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Ado G. is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 35 bags per hectare this season because with this loan, he will finally be able to access the required yield enhancing inputs such as improved seeds. Ado G. is hoping that as a result of this expected yield, he will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what changes he would like to make, he said “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland.  Ultimately, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community.” With this loan, Ado G. will be able to access all the inputs and services to make these dreams reality.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Gie Sorom Group

texts.fr:
Le GIE Sorom est un groupe d’intérêt qui rassemble des membres d’une même famille. Ils s’activent dans l’agriculture depuis des générations. Ils ont des parcelles qui ne sont pas toutes exploitées et c’est dans cet ordre d’idée qu’ils viennent solliciter un crédit pour pouvoir acheter le matériel nécessaire pour mener à bien cette activité. L’achat de semences, d’engrais, de pesticides, de matériel agricole et d’un cheval est le programme fixé pour l’utilisation de ce crédit. Le fils ainé est le responsable du GIE, il s’appelle Cheikhou, âgé de 41 ans, marié et père de trois enfants. Il vit avec ses parents et la dépense quotidienne est partagée entre lui et ses frères. 
L’objectif du GIE est de réussir à mettre en valeur leur espace cultural, mais aussi à diversifier les sources de revenus.
texts.en: The members of the Gie Sorom Group are from the same family. This family has worked in farming for many generations. They have some plots of lands which have yet to be exploited, and it's for this reason that they're requesting a loan to purchase the materials necessary for carrying out this activity. With this loan, they wish to purchase seeds, fertiliser, pesticides, farming supplies and a horse. The eldest son is the representative for the Gie Sorom Group. His name is Cheikhou, he is 41 years old and he is a married father to three children. He lives with his parents and the daily expenses are shared between him and his brothers. The goal of the Gie Sorom Group is male their farming land profitable, as well as diversifying their sources of revenue.

loans.use: to purchase farming inputs, seeds and fertiliser

loans.name: La'azarus

texts.en: La'azarus is a 55-year-old farmer from Barau.  As a Babban Gona member, La'azarus is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, La'azarus can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the national average of 14. However, La'azarus is ambitious and is aiming to reap 40 bags per hectare this season.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make as a Babban Gona member, she said, “I plan to use the money  to educate my children; Samaila, Rajjina, and  Jetron. My overall goal is to make more money for myself and my family”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving these goals.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Poh Gending Lestari Group

texts.en:
The Poh Gending Lestari group make their payment. During the loan periods, they manage a business of raising and fattening sows, and selling piglets. The sows give birth to up to twelve piglets, although some sows will only birth six to eight piglets. Superior sows can produce more piglets than the local sows.

Ni Nengah is very happy because her sow give birth to eleven healthy piglets and she sold all of them. She kept them for two months and sold them to another breeder in her village. All the profits are used as capital in her business, to pay for her pigs and her kiosk. 

Ni Nengah lives in the village of Poh Gending, the middle part of Bali. Ni Nengah's pig business helps support her husband's income. Her husband works as a fisherman.

In order to expand her business, Ni Nengah has raised capital by joining Poh Gending Lestari where she was chosen by other members as the head of the group. They work together with MUK to get business loans for pig farmers. Ni Nengah has a nineteen year old daughter who is still in college.

With the loan of 3,000,000 IDR per person, Ni Nengah plans to buy three piglets at a price of 500,000 IDR each and to use the rest of the loan to purchase feed. Although the price of feed is currently very expensive, Ni Nengah expects the sale of three pigs that later would gain a satisfactory profit  and can increase the income of her husband.

loans.use: To buy high quality piglets and feed

loans.name: Dauda

texts.en: Dauda is a Babban Gona farmer from Chiroma. Dauda expressed that he is driven by one goal; to “become the most profitable farmer in my community.” It is the desire to fulfil this ambition that led Dauda to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Dauda can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Dauda, is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 35 bags per hectare this season. By doing so, Dauda will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what he plans to do with his income from this season, he said: “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland”. With this loan, Dauda will be able to access all the inputs and services to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Shehu

texts.en: Shehu is a Babban Gona farmer from Sarkii. Shehu expressed that he is driven by one goal: to “ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs.” It is the desire to fulfil this ambition that led Shehu to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Shehu can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. By doing so, Shehu will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what he plans to do with his income from this season, he said: “I plan to use the money I make to build a better home.” With this loan, Shehu will be able to access all the inputs and services to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

texts.en: Musa G. is a Babban Gona farmer from Chiroma. Musa G. expressed that he is driven by one goal; to “become the most profitable farmer in my community.” It is the desire to fulfil this ambition that led Musa G. to join Babban Gona. loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Puma Group

texts.en:
Naomi is in her early forties and has three children who are in school. She is married. For three years, she has been a mama lishe (open air food vendor) managing a restaurant serving different foods. She also sells drinks like beer, water, soda, and juice in the same place. She has been in this business for three years now and is able to make a very good profit. Naomi works from 6am to midnight. 

This is her second loan request through Tujijenge Tanzania. With her previous loan, which she repaid successfully, Naomi bought new business chairs to replace defective ones. She wants to make her restaurant more attractive. With good management of her previous loan, she earned extra income that she used to cover her children's school fees and some household expenses. She is back again to request a loan to buy a freezer for her business. She wants to sell cold drinks. She will share this loan with her loan group "Puma," which totals three members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a freezer

loans.name: Carmen Marisol

texts.es:
Carmen, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo para renovar el inventario de la venta de ropa,  comprara vestidos, camisetas, blusas, faldas, pantalones, chores, suéteres, ropa interior, tollas, etc., con nuevos estilos colores y tallas, busca atraer la atención de los clientes y conservar su fidelidad.
Con el crédito anterior a logrado ofertar variedad de ropa a sus clientes con lo que ha podido mejorar sus ventas y tener ingresos extras que ha utilizado para cambiar el estilo de vida familiar, cancelar sus deudas y remodelar el locar.
texts.en:
Carmen decided on a new loan in order to restock her inventory for selling clothes.  She will buy dresses, t-shirts, blouses, skirts, pants, shorts, sweaters, underwear, and towels, etc.  With new styles, colors, and sizes she is looking to attract the customers’ attention and maintain their loyalty.

With the previous loan she managed to offer a variety of clothes to her customers.  By doing so she has been able to improve her sales and have extra income.  She has used the extra income to change her family’s lifestyle, to pay her debts, and to remodel her place.

loans.use: to buy dresses, t-shirts, blouses, skirts, pants, shorts, sweaters, underwear, and towels, etc.

loans.name: Yem

texts.en:
Yem is forty-eight and lives with her husband and six children in a small village of Kampong Cham province. Yem and her husband are farmers in a small rice farm near their house. Even though they have been involved in this career for almost thirty years, their family's livelihood is still not good enough.

For supplementary income, Yem decided to send four of her children to work as construction workers in Thailand. To do this, she needs to pay for official passports and transportation fees for her four children. She estimates this will cost roughly 1,000 USD. She would like to thank the lenders for their financial support towards poor people like her.

loans.use: pay for passports and transportation fees for four people

loans.name: Hadiza

texts.en: Hadiza remembers not being able to pay school fees during a particularly bad harvest. This was before she became a Babban Gona member. Now, Hadiza, like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Hadiza is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. “In 5 years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs” expressed Hadiza. With this loan, he is well on her way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Sari Rejeki Group

texts.en:
This group is located in the middle part of Bali. Most of them have jobs in farming, kiosks or services. The husband work as a mason or a farmer and the wife work as a housewife and farmer, and also in the pig business. So, the women have multiple jobs.

Ni Luh has succeeded in maintaining her pigs. She has sold them at a high price and she earns a satisfactory profit. Now Ni Luh and other members of Sari Rejeki can save their money for their future and they hope the business runs smoothly and increases their incomes.

Ni Luh wants to increase her business by keeping local pigs for pig roll. She needs a new loan to purchase three local pigs and to renovate the cage. The pig for pig barbeque is usually only kept for two to three months and then sold. Her husband supports her business by helping her to give feed and clean the barn. Ni Luh saves her profit, because she has a dream to renovate her kitchen. 

Ni Luh and other members of Sari Rejeki group hope their businesses grow and support their family income to fulfill their daily needs, school fees and savings.

Ni Luh, front row, wearing blue shirt.

loans.use: to purchase three local pigs and renovate the cage.

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru:
Это Гулнора. Она бизнеследи с города Истаравшан. Ей 39 лет. Гулнора и ее муж совместно занимаются торговым бизнесом. На протяжении 7 лет они на рынке города торгуют тканями и материалами. Они оба управляют семейным бизнесом. Кроме этого бизнеса у них нет другого источника дохода, поэтому они все свое внимание уделяют его развитию.    
Гулнора и ее муж растут двоих детей - дочку и сына. Они думают об их будущем и хотят, чтобы их дети в будущем получили достойное образование. Для этого они развивают бизнес, чтобы увеличить семейный бюджет. Гулнора берет кредит, чтобы привезти новую партию тканей и материалов для увеличения их ассортимента. Таким образом они смогут увеличить объем продаж.
texts.en:
This is Gulnora. She is a businesswoman from the city of Istaravshan. Gulnora and her husband jointly run a retail business. For the past 7 years, that have been selling fabric and materials at the city market. They both run this family business. They do not have any additional sources of income besides this business, which is why they devote all of their attention to its development.

Gulnora and her husband are raising two children - a daughter and a son. They think a lot about their future and want their children to receive a good education in the future. For this reason, they are developing their business to increase their family's budget. Gulnora is taking out a loan to bring in a new shipment of fabric and materials to increase her assortment. In this way, she will be able to increase her sales volume.

loans.use: to buy fabric and materials for retail sale.

loans.name: Gie Jappo Senela Keur Abdou Group

texts.fr:
Le GIE Jappo Senela Keur Abdou, regroupe des femmes qui évoluent dans le secteur de l’agriculture. Ayant besoin d’un appui financier pour faire leur activité, elles ont sollicité un crédit de 250 000f afin de pouvoir acheter des semences et de l’engrais et cultiver leurs terres.
Madame Fatou, située à la gauche sur la photo, est la responsable de groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de famille. Elle fait du maraichage pendant des années. Le crédit lui servira à l’achat de semences, d’engrais et de pesticides. Les produits de l’activité sont  divisés en deux parties, l’une sera destinée à la vente et l’autre pour la consommation au sein de la famille.
Fatou désire avoir un grand verger et y cultiver toute sorte de variété de fruits et légumes.
texts.en: The Gie Jappo Senela Keur Abdou Group brings together women who work in the farming sector. As they need financial aid in order to carry out their work, they have requested a 250,000 XOF loan to purchase seeds and fertiliser so that they can farm their land. Fatou, the woman to the left of the photo, is the group representative. She is a married mother. She has been farming for many years. This loan will be used to purchase seeds, fertiliser and pesticides. The produce from this activity will be split in two: one half will be sold on and the other half will be consumed by the family. Fatou wants to own a large orchard and grow many varieties of fruits and vegetables there.

loans.use: to purchase farming inputs, seeds and fertiliser

loans.name: Diego

texts.es:
Todas las mañanas la frescura del viento de la mañana y el sol saliente son testigos al ver a Diego de 59 años y casado por los caminos de Sololá con rumbo hacia su terreno listo para sentir la mano sembradora y cosechadora de su dueño.

Llevando ya 25 años dedicándose a la agricultura en su comunidad,  llega al pueblo para vender sus verduras como producto de la siembra y cosecha en su terreno.

Algunos de sus  hijos, que deben acompañarlo a este trabajo de la agricultura, lo forman ocho , cuyos  cinco ya son casados y tres son todavía pequeños y están en edad de estudio.

La necesidad y única dedicación de don Diego a la agricultura y remodelación de su vivienda, le han hecho solicitar un préstamo para vivir más tranquilo y la tierra  y su familia estén más contentos.

Y así el sol y el viento seguirán mirando como admirando el camino trazado por don Diego y como ejemplo para su familia, un camino de trabajo, esfuerzo, dedicación y esperanza para el futuro.
texts.en:
Every morning, the cool morning breeze and the rising sun witness Diego, 59 and married, walking the roads of Solola on his way to his plot of land that is waiting to feel Diego's sowing and harvesting hand.
Diego has worked as a farmer in his community for 25 years. In the village he sells the vegetables that he has sowed and harvested in his land. Some of Diego's children help him with the farming. He has 8 children, 5 of whom are already married. The other three are still young and they are studying.
The fact that Diego's only source of income is farming and the need to remodel his home have led him to ask for this loan so he can live more at ease and have his land and family better taken care of. In this way, the sun and the wind will continue to watch and admire Diego's path and the example he sets for his family, that of a road of hard work, sacrifice, dedication and hope for the future.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies and to remodel his home.

loans.name: Elkin Leon

texts.es:
Una vivienda propia es lo que se ha soñado toda la vida el señor Elkin quien hace 12 años se dedica a distribuir carne en una carnicería ubicada en el municipio de puerto Boyacá la cual ha sido muy difícil de mantener debido a lso conflictos armados y los impuesto que le hacían pagar bandas ilegales para poder operar. 

Quiere solicitar un crédito el cual lo usara para la compra de una vitrina mostradora y una res con lo que mejora su capital y podrá invertir plata en su casa propia, por eso el crédito es de tanta importancia para él pues será un paso muy grande para realizar ese preciado sueño y dejar atrás una vida tan difícil que le toco.
texts.en: Elkin has dreamed of his own home for his entire life. For 12 years, he has sold meat in a butcher's shop located in the town of Puerto Boyacá. It has been difficult to maintain it due to armed conflicts and the taxes that he has had to pay to illegal gangs in order to be able to operate it. He wants to apply for a loan in order to buy a display case and beef with which he will increase his profits. He wil be able to invest money in his own home, which is why the loan in so important to him. The loan will be a very big step towards realizing his valued dream and leaving behind the difficulties he has had.

loans.use: to buy a display case and beef

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en: Mohammed remembers not being able to feed his family  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now,  Mohammed, like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Mohammed  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 45 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”, expressed Mohammed. With this loan, Mohammed is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Alejandra Elizabeth

texts.es:
Alejandra, vive en con su mamá y sus hermanas; se dedica  a la venta de ropa y sandalias,  no tiene un horario fijo de atención al público, le colaboran su mamá y sus hermanas, con los ingresos cubre sus necesidades personales y aporta a los gastos familiares.
 Invertirá en la compra de pantalones, pijamas, camisas, blusas, faldas, vestidos y distintos diseños de sandalias, responderá  a la demanda de sus clientes, podrá sobresalir en el mercado ofertando una variedad de productos a mejor precio, espera que sus ingresos san mayores con los que resarcirá la deuda y seguirá apoyando económicamente a su familia.
Su aspiración es que su negocio sea lo suficientemente rentable para que sea auto sostenible.
texts.en:
Alejandra lives with her mother and her sisters.  She sells clothes and sandals.  She does not have a fixed schedule for selling to the public.  Her mother and her sisters collaborate, and with the profits she covers her personal necessities and contributes to the family expenses.

She will use the loan to buy pants, pajamas, shirts, blouses, skirts, dresses, and different designs of sandals.  She will respond to her customer demand, and she will be able to succeed in the market by offering a variety of products at a better price.

She hopes that her income will be greater, and she will use it to repay the debt and continue supporting her family financially.

Her aspiration is for her business to be profitable enough to be self-sustaining.

loans.use: to buy pants, pajamas, shirts, blouses, skirts, dresses, and different designs of sandals.

loans.name: Zakka

texts.en: Zakka is a 25-year-old farmer from Chiroma.  As a Babban Gona member, Zakka is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Zakka can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the national average of 14. However, Zakka is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make as a Babban Gona member, his said, “I plan to use the money  to educate my children. My overall goal is to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving these goals.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Zulaykho

texts.ru: Зулайхо трудолюбивая женщина. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Детям 3 и 5 лет. Зулайхо 7 лет назад окончила педагогический колледж. Зулайхо окончила колледж успешно и сразу после окончания колледжа поступила на работу в среднюю школу. Зулайхо в течение 7 лет работает в средней школе. Она очень любит свою работу и работает с удовольствием. Ее муж занимается купле продажей скота. Зулайхо и ее муж хотят отремонтировать дом и таким образом улучшить условию проживания. Зулайхо запрашивает займ на сумму 2500 сомони для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, краски, обои и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Zulaykho is a hardworking woman. She is married and raising 2 children, who are 3 and 5 years old. Zulaykho graduated from a pedagogical college 7 years ago. She successfully completed college and started working at a secondary school right away. Zulaykho has been working at a secondary school for 7 years. She loves her work very much and does it with satisfaction. Her husband is involved in reselling livestock. Zulaykho and her husband want to repair their house and improve their living conditions. Zulaykho is requesting a loan in the amount of 2500 somoni to buy construction materials, such as cement, paint, wallpaper, etc. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy construction materials, such as cement, paint, wallpaper, etc., in order to repair her house

loans.name: Segundo Ramon

texts.es: Segundo es un señor muy trabajador, el vive con su esposa y con sus  3 hijos de los cuales uno de 14 años está estudiando, Segundo se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo de papas y de productos propios de su localidad, Segundo también trabaja de chofer, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de abono y fungicidas para tener bien sus cultivos y seguir trabajando para su esposa e hijos.
texts.en: Segundo is a hardworking gentleman who lives with his wife and three children, one of whom is a 14 year old student.  He is engaged in farming, and cultivates potatoes and his own local products.  Segundo also works as a driver.  He will invest the loan in the purchase of manure and fungicides so that he can have good crops and continue working for his wife and children.

loans.use: to purchase manure and fungicides.

loans.name: Mohidil

texts.ru: Мохидил добрая женщина. Она разведенная и имеет одного ребенка. Мохидил работает и живет на севере Таджикистана. Она более 5 лет занимается предоставлением услуги швеи. Она шьет национальные женские платья. Мохидил сама справляется с бизнесом. Мохидил всегда старается предоставлять своим клиентам услуги на высшем уровне и таким образом привлечь их. Мохидил обратилась за займом, так как она хочет отремонтировать свой дом и таким образом улучшить условию проживания. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, древесина и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Mohidil is a kind woman. She is divorced and has one child. Mohidil lives and works in the north of Tajikistan. She has been providing seamstress services for over 5 years. She sews women's national dresses. Mohidil handles the business by herself. She always tries to attract clients by offering the highest quality services to them. Mohidil requested this loan because she wants to repair her house and improve her living conditions. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 5000 somoni to buy construction materials, such as cement, wood, etc. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: to buy construction materials, such as cement, wood, etc., in order to repair her house

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr:
Mariée et mère d’un enfant, Adjo est âgée de 34 ans et réside à Adidogomé. Elle est revendeuse de détergent au marché d’assiyéyé. Adjo s’approvisionne une fois par mois au grand marché de Lomé et gère toute seule son activité.
Adjo sollicite un prêt pour augmenter son stock de détergent afin de répondre aux besoins de ses clients et augmenter son bénéfice.
texts.en: A married mother to one child, Adjo is 34 years old and lives in Adidogomé. She sells detergent at the market in Assiyéyé. Adjo gets her supplies once per month from the large market in Lomé and carries out her business on her own. Adjo is requesting a loan in order to increase her stocks of detergent so that she can better meet her customer's needs and increase her profits.

loans.use: to purchase 15 bags of detergent

loans.name: Adamu

texts.en: Adamu is a 25-year-old farmer from Kofar Pada.  As a Babban Gona member, Adamu is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Adamu can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Adamu is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, he will be able to access quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will  result in a yield of at least 35 bags of maize per hectare this season.  Adamu is hopeful about what the future holds; he  hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, he will finally be able to afford to educate his children:  Hansu,  Hadiza  and  Ibrahim. Adamu’s dreams do not end here: “ultimately, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”, he said.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Rahila

texts.en: Rahila remembers the depression she felt  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before she became a Babban Gona member. Now, Rahila, like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Rahila is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to make more money for myself and my family”, expressed Rahila. With this loan, Rahila is well on her way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Rokiya

texts.ru:
Рокия местная жительница города Турсунзаде. Ей 58 лет. Она трудолюбивая и добродушная женщина. Рокия как и многие ее односельчане при дворе дома имеет коровник и разводит скотов. Животноводческую деятельность она начала 15 лет назад и вся семья помогает ей в этом. Рокия живет вместе с тремя детьми, невесткой и мужем. Семья для нее опора и поддержка в жизни. 
Рокия в данный момент хочет расширить семейный бизнес. Она просит кредит для купли еще одного маленького бычка для откорма и перепродажи. Она надеется на поддержку.
texts.en: Rokiya is a local resident of the city of Tursun-zoda. She is 58 years old. She is a hardworking and good-natured woman. Like many of her fellow villagers, Rokiya has a cowshed in the yard surrounding her house where she raises cattle. She started her livestock breeding business 15 years ago. All of her family helps her with it. Rokiya lives with her three children, daughter-in-law and husband. Family is the anchor and support in her life. Now Rokiya wants to expand her family business. She is requesting a loan to buy another young bull to fatten up and resell. She relies on your support.

loans.use: to buy a young bull.

loans.name: Sayora

texts.ru: Сайёра добрая женщина. Она родилась в 1979 году. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Ее дети несовершеннолетние. Сайёра работает в фермерском хозяйстве. Основным семейным доходом является выращивание и продажа сельхоз культур. Сайёра хочет отремонтировать свой дом, так как ее дом в плохом состоянии. Сайёра запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, древесина и т.п. Она нуждается и ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Sayora is a kind woman. She was born in 1979. She is married and raising 3 children, all of whom are underage. Sayora works on a farm. The family primary income comes from growing and selling agricultural crops. Sayora wants to repair her house because it is in a bad condition. Sayora is requesting a loan in the amount of 5000 somoni to buy construction materials, such as cement, wood, etc. She needs and awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy construction materials, such as cement, wood, etc., to repair her house

loans.name: Norbiby

texts.ru: Норбиби родилась в 1975 году. Она ответственная мать 6 детей. Норбиби уже более 10 лет занимается собственным бизнесом. Она изготавливает самбуса и продает на местном рынке. Норбиби имеет постоянных покупателей на местном рынке. Ее муж помогает ей введению бизнеса. Норбиби обратилась в ИМОН за займом с целью получения займа в сумме 4000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, песок, окна и двери. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Norbiby was born in 1975. She is a responsible mother of 6 children. Norbiby has been involved in her own business for over 10 years. She cooks samosas and sells them at a local market. Norbiby has regular customers at the local market. Her husband helps her with running the business. Norbiby comes to IMON to obtain a loan in the amount of 4000 somoni to buy construction materials, such as cement, sand, windows and doors. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy construction materials, such as cement, sand, windows and doors, to repair her house

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en: Carmela is 42 years old, married to a company driver, and blessed with two children. She has been selling fish for almost 15 years in their village and earns a net income of PHP 3,000 a week. She's hoping that her business will continue to become more productive so that she can earn a better income, but has insufficient funds to expand it. Therefore, she would like to obtain a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Amador

texts.en:
Amador is a hardworking entrepreneur from Silang Cavite, Philippines.  He is 58 years old, married to Eden and has five children who are currently in school.  He sells fresh fish to provide for the everyday needs and expenditures of the family.

He buys different kinds of fish at wholesale prices and sells them by the kilo. He buys fish at the local fish port early in the morning. There are many patrons who prefer his products because they are assured of its freshness and cleanliness. His store is located in a temporary fish market. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of Php1,000 in sales every day.

Amador is taking out PHP 15,000 loan assistance to continue operations of his business. He will be utilizing the loan to buy more fish, which are necessary to increase his inventory.

He hopes for his income to grow and desires to improve the family's general living conditions. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God he studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more fish to be sold at the market.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija operates a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She appreciates the support of the previous loans and she is now able to expand her business. Hadija dreams of establishing a wholesale business in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase 3 bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar for the business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 3 bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, school fees and transport.

For the past seven years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge with the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan of Kes 20,000 that she is requesting, she wants to purchase 2 bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 2 bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es:
Jorge de 34 años de edad, es agricultor, estudió hasta quinto grado, debido al bajo nivel academico se le dificulta conseguir un trabajo en el que obtenga mejores ingresos, debido a esto ha tenido que hacerle frente con el trabajo de la agricultura para mantener a su familia, esta casado y tienen 4 hijos, asisten a la escuela, su esposa es ama de casa y es la que le apoya mucho para sacar adelante a sus pequeños.

Jorge se ha dedicado desde muy pequeño a la agricultura, se levanta muy temprano para ir al campo a trabajar, esta cerca de su casa, tambien se dedica a la venta de pan dulce y frances, esto lo hace por las tardes en una motocicleta, se traslada a otras comunidades y a los alrededores de su hogar.


Con el préstamo comprará insumos agricolas tales como abono, veneno y semilla.

El sueño de Jorge es tener buenos resultados con el cultivo para cancelar a tiempo su préstamo. Asi mismo tener algun dia casa propia y darle estudio univeritario a sus hijos, para que tengan mayores oportunidades de trabajo y por ende mejorar la calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jorge is 34 years old. He is a farmer. He studied through the fifth grade and he has had a difficult time obtaining well-paying jobs due to his low academic level. Due to this, he has had to work in agriculture to support his family. He is married and has 4 children who attend school. His wife is a housewife who supports him a lot so their children can get ahead. 

Jorge has worked in agriculture since he was small. He wakes up very early to go to the fields near his house to work. He also sells sweet bread and french bread. He does this in the afternoon by traveling to other communities surrounding his home on a motorcycle.

With this loan, he will buy agricultural products such as manure, pesticides, and seeds. Jorge's dream is to have a big harvest so he can repay the loan on time. He also hopes to have his own home and pay for his children to attend the university so they have better job opportunities and can ultimately improve their quality-of-life.

loans.use: to buy manure, pesticides, and seeds

loans.name: Lawan

texts.en: Lawan is a 55-year-old farmer from Ba'awa.  As a Babban Gona member, Lawan, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist.  Like all Babban Gona members, Lawan can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Lawan is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Lawan said “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children: Sale, Kabiru,and Basi, and in 5 years, I want to make more money for myself and my family.” With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Barnabas

texts.en: Barnabas is a 35-year-old farmer from Jaki.  As a Babban Gona member, Barnabas, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist.  Like all Babban Gona members, Barnabas can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Barnabas is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Barnabas said “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children: Jamila, Mark, and Manase, and in 5 years, I want to make more money for myself and my family”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru: Фотиме 44 года. Она проживает в районе А.Джоми. Ее семья владеет дехканским хозяйством, где работают муж и сыновья. Сама Фотима животновод. Она разводит и быков и овец. Корм для скотов она берет со своих земельных участков. У Фотимы большой опыт в области животноводства. Она выращивает скот в течение 21 года. Фотима обычно откармливает скот в течение месяца и затем выводит на продажу. В данный момент она хочет увеличить поголовье крупнорогатого скота и с такой целью обратилась за кредитом. С помощью кредита она хочет увеличить доходность своего бизнеса и надеется на поддержку.
texts.en: Fotima is 44 years old. She lives in the A. Jomi district. Her family owns a dekhan farm, where her husband and sons work. Fotima is involved in animal husbandry. She raises bulls and sheep. She gets the livestock feed from her land plots. Fotima has a lot of experience in the animal husbandry field. She has been raising livestock for 21 years. Fotima typically fattens up livestock for a month and then sells it. At the present time, she wants to increase her cattle headcount and requested a loan for this purpose. She wants to increase the profitability of her business with the help of this loan and hopes for the support.

loans.use: to buy cattle and expand her business

loans.name: And Liggey Senela Keur Abdou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de crédit nommé And Liggey Sénéla Keur Abdou regroupe des femmes qui s’activent dans le domaine de l’agriculture. Elles ont hérité cette activité de leurs parents, car elles vivent dans un village et la terre est la principale source de revenu. 
Madame Ndèye Diarra, qui est à gauche sur la photo, est la responsable. Elle sollicite un crédit pour acheter des semences et de l’engrais et cultiver son champ avec son mari et ses enfants. La famille vit des recettes de l’activité qui est permanente.
Ndèye Diarra pense à faire de l’aviculture pour améliorer les conditions alimentaires de la famille.
texts.en: The And Liggey Sénéla Keur Abdou Group brings together woman who work in the farming sector. They inherited this activity from their parents, as they live in a village where farming is the main source of income. Ndèye Diarra, the woman to the left of the photo, is the group representative. She is requesting a loan to purchase seeds and fertiliser so that she can grow produce on her land along with her husband and their children. The family lives off the takings from this activity. Ndèye Diarra is considering raising chickens in order to improve her family's dietary conditions.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertiliser

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is age 51, married, and blessed with two children. She has owned and managed a retail store in the village for almost four years, earning a net income of about PHP 4,000 daily. Her net income is usually spent on daily expenses. 

Due to insufficient funds, she would like a loan amounting to PHP 20,000 to purchase raw meat, rice grains, fish, frozen foods, noodles and canned goods to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase raw meat, rice grains, fish, frozen foods, noodles and canned goods to sell.

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en:
Rodrigo lives in Solana with his family. He is 35 years old and has four children. To make a living, he started a hog-raising business where he raises hogs to sell upon achieving the desired weight. He was able to gain a good income for the sustenance of his family. 

He is now asking for a loan of P50,000 because he has insufficient funds to sustain his hogs. He will buy a supply of hog feed and medicines. In giving enough sustenance, the hogs will grow healthier and he will be able to sell them at a higher price. He hopes to become successful in his business.

Rodrigo also prays for his family's good health and abundance.

loans.use: to buy hog feed and medicines.

loans.name: Alrey

texts.en:
Alrey is studying in a university to gain a better education. He is single and he helps his parents in their business on weekends, when he doesn't have any scheduled time for a group study. His parents are earning a little income from selling fish in their village. He used his previous loan to pay his tuition fee for the second semester of the previous school year. He is thankful to GDMPC for helping him to pursue his dream. 

Alrey took out a new loan recently to pay his tuition fee for the first semester of this current year. Alrey would like to find a job that fits his qualifications and to earn money, to own a business for a better future.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for the first semester.

loans.name: Zenen Plinio

texts.es:
Zenen es un joven emprendedor, tiene 19 años de edad, es soltero y vive en Ica junto a su familia.
Es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Desde hace algún tiempo trabaja en el rubro de confecciones, realizando labores de bordado, estampado de polos, chompas, etc. Le va muy bien porque es muy responsable, innovador, trabajador y siempre se preocupa por realizar trabajos de excelente calidad.
Su mayor motivación en la vida es su familia, es por ellos que lucha día a día para poder brindarles un mejor futuro.
Zenen está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprar un televisor para su casa, de esta manera pueda mejorar la calidad e vida de su familia, también podrá disfrutar junto a sus padres gratos momentos viendo sus programas preferidos. Así Zenen seguirá esforzándose para sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Zenen is a young, 19 year old entrepreneur.  He is single and lives in Ica Junto with his family.  He is a person with a strong desire to succeed.  For some time, he has been working as a tailor, doing embroidery, and designing patterns for t-shirts, sweaters, etc.  It is going very well because he is very responsible, innovative, hardworking, and always concerned with creating high quality work.  His greatest motivation in life is his family, and he strives daily to be able to offer them a better future.

Zenen is grateful for the Kiva loans because the support they have provided will enable him to purchase a television for his home.  In this way, he can improve his family’s quality of life, and also enjoy pleasant times with his parents watching their favorite programs.  Thus, Zenen will continue strengthening himself to get his family ahead.

loans.use: to purchase a television.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita, a resident of Bonifacio, Zamboanga del Sur, is a widow with four children. She is a farmer and she is earning income by operating a farm to make a living. She joined Gata Daku MPC and it helps her improve her quality of life. She borrowed a new loan to buy fertilizer. She was determined to improve their lives and with this belief, she never gets tired of working in their farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Soeurn's Group

texts.en: Soeurn, a resident of the Preah Vihear province, is a father of three children. He is 40 years old and earns a living through rice farming and animal raising. This business earns him about 19,000 KHR per day. Soeurn is quite new to VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), the same as his co-borrowers in the group (consisting of four). Now, he is a leader in his group. For Soeurn, he will spend his entire loan portion to set up the solar panels for his family so that he can improve the standard of living for his family.

loans.use: to set up the solar panels for his family

location.town: Preah Vihear Province, Chaom Ksan District

loans.name: Barnabas

texts.en: Barnabas is a 27-year-old farmer from Barau.  As a Babban Gona member, Barnabas is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Barnabas can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the national average of 14. However, Barnabas is ambitious and is aiming to reap 70 bags per hectare this season.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money  to educate my children; Samaila, Lydia, and  Jetro. My overall goal is to make more money for myself and my family”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving these goals.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Murtala

texts.en: Murtala remembers feeling depressed  during a particularly bad harvest. This is before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now, as a Babban Gona member, Murtala like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the National average of 14. However, Murtala,  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 80 bags per hectare this season.  Murtala expressed that “In 5 years, I want to make more money for myself and my family.” With this loan, Murtala is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Lailani

texts.en: Lailani is 41 years old and from Moncada, Tarlac. She is married and has five children. What her husband earns from working in construction is not enough. To help him send their children to school, she wants to avail a loan of 10,000 PHP from Kiva lenders. It will be used for the tuition fees for their daughter, Laneilyn. She is 16 years old and taking up Computer Programming. Laneilyn chose this course because this is her passion and believes that she can get a profitable job through this.

loans.use: To pay for her daughter's tuition fees

loans.name: Marziya

texts.ru: Марзия 44-летняя сельская женщина родом из городка Турсунзаде. Она как и многие женщины сельской местности не имеет высшего образования, поэтому она нигде не работала и вела домашнее хозяйство. Лишь 7 лет назад Марзия при поддержке мужа начала животноводческий бизнес. Эта деятельность пришлось ей по душе и она по сей день занимается разведением крупнорогатых скотин. Марзия теперь после того как приобрела достаточный опыт хочет немного расширить бизнес. Она за счет кредита собирается увеличить поголовье скотин в скотном дворе. Этот кредит ей очень важен.
texts.en: Marziya is a 44-year-old country woman. She is a native of the city of Tursun-zoda. Like many rural women, she does not have a higher education which is why she does not work anywhere and instead runs the household. Just seven years ago, Marziya started her own livestock breeding business with the help of her husband. She really enjoys this business and raises cattle to this day. Now that she has acquired enough experience, Marziya wants to expand her business a bit. With the requested loan, she is planning to increase the number of cattle in her barnyard. This loan is very important to her.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en: Jimmy is 32 years old and from Paniqui, Tarlac. He is taking up Computer Programming. He wants to finish his college education and get a job in order to be able to help his family. To do this, he wants to seek financial assistance from the KIVA lenders. He is asking for a Php10,000 loan to pay his tuition fees. This amount is a great way for him to start achieving his dreams in life; thus he is very positive that kindhearted lenders will approve his request.

loans.use: To pay his tuition fees.

loans.name: Maarifa Group

texts.en:
Ramadhani is a married father of three sons and one daughter (two in school and the rest grown). He is in his mid-forties and has been a businessman for 10 years. He runs a barbershop, a grocery store selling rice, sugar, beans, baking and maize flour etc., and also manages a food business selling chips with meat fried in pieces. He is so happy with Kiva's support because now he can pay his children's school fees and household costs. He believes that one day he will be a successfully businessman. He normally works from 6 a.m. to midnight every working day. 

Ramadhani is requesting his 13th loan through Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous credits, which he repaid, to improve his businesses. He bought food inventory, a refrigerator and radio, and a television set for his barbershop. He received profits which he used to build a house with electricity. He covered school fees and household expenses. Ramadhani dreams to grow his businesses and become better off in life. With his new loan request, he will replenish his grocery store with rice, beans, sugar, baking flour, maize flour, etc.

He will share this loan with his loan group Maarifa which consists of five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to replenish his shop with rice, beans, sugar, baking flour, maize flour etc.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en: Victor owns and operates an agriculture business growing coconut for sale. He has been in this business for many years and earns a good income from it. Although his farm is still doing well, he needs financial assistance to improve it. Recently, he took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy fertilizer. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from his farm to improve his family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores has been operating her own variety store for years, and she earns well from this. She is from Cavite, Philippines, 35 years of age, and is married to Fernando. Having a bigger responsibility requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her children. She and her husband have to work hard for they are determined to have more income than they currently have.

In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

Due to financial insufficiency, Dolores wants to make her business more profitable in order to earn a higher income. For this reason, she would like a loan amounting to 11,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy additional grocery items that are needed. Being a kind and friendly mother, she is hoping that she will further improve the business through this financial assistance.

Dolores hopes to grow and expand her business. She dreams of providing the best education for her children. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Carmelina

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Carmelina works hard to support her family.

She has a pig-fattening business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and a general store. Carmelina is borrowing 29,500 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs for her pig-fattening business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Carmelina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Arafa

texts.en:
Arafa is a widowed woman. She has four children, all of whom attend school. The family lives in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Arafa has operated a business selling fresh water for the past five years, selling from home to her neighbours. She faces a major challenge of seasonality, especially the during rainy season when business is slow. 

With the 20,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase a water tank and install a water tap for her business. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank and install a water tap

loans.name: Laly

texts.en:
Laly is a married mother of two children who are adults. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense are rental bills.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high transportation costs. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 20,000, she wants to purchase one bale of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase one bale of clothes for resale

loans.name: Sreynin's Group

texts.en: A local farmer from the Preah Vihea province, where electricity is quite a challenge in the area, Sreynin is 28 years old and has two kids who are too young for schooling. To assist the family in her household, she grows rice and sells sweet as her main sources of income. This business has generated her about 24,000 KHR per day. Now, she teams up with a group, consisting of five, for her first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy solar lighting for her home. She hopes that she can afford to have enough electricity supply for her family's use.

loans.use: to buy solar lighting for her home

location.town: Preah Vihear Province, Chaom Ksan District

loans.name: Kunduz

texts.ru: Кундуз 29 лет, замужем, есть сын школьник. У Кундуз среднее образование, она спокойная, уравновешенная и трудолюбивая. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, уже много лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. Начав свой бизнес 10 лет назад практически с нуля. Благодаря упорному труду Кундуз в ее хозяйстве имеется 10 овец, а также есть земельный надел, мерою 1,50 ГА, на котором она выращивает клевер. Деятельность Кундуз приносит около 20,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. Супруг и дети помогают по бизнесу. Также супруг Кундуз работает на заводе. Общими усилиями, Кундуз и ее супруг сделали ремонт в доме, незавершенной осталась только мансарда. В целях завершения ремонта мансарды, ее утепления и переделки под детскую комнату, Кундуз обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS). На полученные средства она купит шифер, балки и пластиковые окна и двери. Доходы от животноводческой деятельности позволят Кундуз в дальнейшем развивать ее бизнес и построить на территории дома беседку.
texts.en: Kunduz is 29 years old, married and has a school-age son. Kunduz has a secondary education. She is calm, leveled and hardworking. To provide an aditional source of income for her family, she has been involved in animal husbandry and farming for many years, having started this business practically with nothing. Thanks to Kunduz's hard work, today her business contains 10 sheep and a 1.50 hectare land plot, where she grows clover. Kunduz's business yields about 20,000 som (KGS) per month. Her husband and son help her with the business. Kunduz's husband also works at a factory. Through their joint effort, Kunduz and her husband made repairs at home, leaving only the attic unfinished. In order to complete the repairs in the attic, insulating and converting it into a children's room, Kunduz requested a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank. She will use the loan to buy slates, beams and plastic windows and doors. The earnings from the animal husbandry business will allow Kunduz to further develop her business and build a gazebo on her property.

loans.use: to buy slates, beams and plastic windows and doors to insulate the attic and convert it into a children's room

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en: A resident from Preah Vireah province, Sok is a 33-year-old mother blessed with three kids. Now, only one of her children is in school. She earns a living through rice farming and animal raising. This business earns her about 19,900 KHR per day. Now, she wants to set up solar lighting for her home. Therefore, she forms a group of four to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy solar panels. She hopes to have electricity to use, especially at night for her kids.

loans.use: to buy solar panels

location.town: Preah Vihear Province, Chaom Ksan District

loans.name: Sopheap's Group

texts.en: Sopheap, a villager from the Preah Vihea province, is 55 years old and married. She strives for a living through rice farming and animal raising. This business has returned her up to 17,000 KHR per day, from the business that she has had for 5 years. Now, in a group of five, she is a leader.  For Sopheap, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy solar panels for her family. She hopes to have electricity to be used at night time to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy solar panels for her family

location.town: Preah Vihear Province, Chaom Ksan District

loans.name: Maryamu

texts.en: Maryamu is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Maryamu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her  children: Rajjina, Saminu, and  Ketira. Maryamu is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Maryamu will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, she would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Maryamu can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and  earn up to $2000/ha: more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked how she plans to spend the income she will make this year  as a Babban Gona member, she said, “I plan to use the money  to expand my farmland.” Maryamu is not thinking about this year alone; she expressed that his long-term goal is to “ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”. With this loan, she is well on her way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Abubakar

texts.en: Abubakar is a 30-year-old farmer from Gangarida.  As a Babban Gona member, Abubakar is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Abubakar can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the national average of 14. However, Abubakar is ambitious and is aiming to reap 70 bags per hectare this season.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money  to educate my children; Umar,Fisal, and Fati. My overall goal is to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving these goals.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr:
Âgée de 47 ans, elle habite avec son mari et son enfant à Adidogomé. Commerçante de chaussure depuis 5 ans, elle a ajouté la vente de pagne à son commerce  pour sa diversification. Abra s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé une fois par mois et revend au marché d’assiyéyé par la vente ambulante. 
Abra sollicite un microcrédit pour agrandir son commerce afin d’en tirer plus de bénéfices.
texts.en: Abra is 47 years old and lives with her husband and child in Adidogomé. She has worked as a shoe-seller for five years and has added pagne cloth to her merchandise in order to diversify her business. Abra gets her supplies from the main market in Lomé once per month and resells her goods at the market in Assiyéyé as a wandering merchant. Abra is requesting this loan in order to grow her business and increase her profits.

loans.use: to purchase 48 pairs of shoes and 12 lengths of pagne cloth

loans.name: Doen's Group

texts.en: Doen is 59 years old, a farmer and a married man with five children. Three of his children are workers and two are students. His wife is also a farmer. They live in Tbong Khmum Province, Cambodia. All of them can earn approximately $30 per day. Now Doen would like to request a loan of 810,000 Riels as a group of three members and he will use his portion to buy concrete sewers and other foundation parts of a latrine. This loan will help him live in better conditions and avoid illnesses. In the future, he is going to expand his farmland, build a new house and support his children to study to be teachers.

loans.use: to buy concrete sewers and other foundation parts of a latrine

loans.name: Inga

texts.ru:
Инга продает женскую одежду и постельное белье на протяжении 5 лет. Ранее она работала на предприятии, но ей не платили зарплату. Тогда Инга решила работать на себя. Она пунктуальная, порядочная и трудолюбивая. Инга хочет развивать бизнес, чтобы оплачивать в будущем учебу детей. 

Инга просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 20,000 гривен на закупку женской одежды и постельного белья.
texts.en: Inga has been selling women's clothing and bed sheets for the past five years. Previously, she worked in a factory, but they did not pay her salary. Then Inga decided to work for herself. She is punctual, organized and hardworking. Inga wants to develop her business so that she can pay for her children's education in the future. Inga is requesting a loan for 20,000 hryvnia to buy women's clothing and bed sheets.

loans.use: to purchase women's clothing and bed sheets

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en:
Sarah's group is comprised of two hardworking women. Sarah is 23 years old and lives in the town of Kaliro in the Iganga region of Uganda. For the past four years, she has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 800000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda buy more new clothes to sell. This will help her to generate greater profits and provide for the family's basic needs. She hopes that in the future she will be able to open another branch of the same business. 

Sarah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more new clothes to sell

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.ru:
Дилором - фермер из района Спитамен, начинает новый бизнес. Ее интересует купля и продажа крупнорогатого скота. Она построила при дворе дома сарай для содержания скотов. И теперь для купли двух голов коров и корма Дилором просит кредит, так как начального капитала не хватает. 
Дилором 28 лет. Она замужем за дехканина. Ее муж занимается выращиванием моркови и лука. Дилором наравне мужа тоже хочет приносить домой доход. Она очень надеется на финансовую поддержку. Так как благодаря кредиту у нее будет работа, приносящая хороший доход.
texts.en:
Dilorom, a farmer from the Spitamen District, is starting a new business. She is interested in buying and selling cattle. In the yard around her house, she built a barn for housing the cattle. Now Dilorom is requesting a loan to buy two cows and cattle feed, as her start-up capital is not enough for this purchase.

Dilorom is 28 years old. She is married to a farmer. Her husband grows carrots and onions. Dilorom also wants to bring an income home on par with her husband. She really relies on financial support. Thanks to this loan, she will have a job that will bring in a good income.

loans.use: to buy two purebred cows as well as cattle feed.

loans.name: Mpunga Group

texts.en:
Benjamini is a businessman running a shop selling dry food such as rice, beans, sugar, baking flour and maize flour. He is a single man in his late twenties and has got one kid who is in kindergarten. He has been in this enterprise for three years now. Benjamini works from 06am to 09pm daily and is able to make a good profit each month. 

He is requesting a third loan to be apportioned among Mpunga's three-member group.  Benjamini used the previous loans to replenish his shop with food, and he paid the loans back successfully. He received extra income which he used to pay school fees and household expenses. In the coming years, he would like to build a house and improve his life. 

Benjamini will invest his loan to replenish his shop with rice, beans, sugar, baking flour and maize flour. He will share this loan with his loan group "MPUNGA", which totals three members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to replenish his shop with rice, beans, sugar, baking flour and maize flour.

loans.name: Esie

texts.en:
Esie is now 62 years old, married and has six children, three of whom are married, while the other three are working. She has been running her retail store for 10 months and aspires to a stable source of income in order to achieve her goals in life.

Esie is seeking a loan of PHP7,000 to re-stock her retail store through the purchase of grocery items such as cases of soft drinks, canned goods, cooking oil and rice. She hopes to avail this loan to sustain her family's needs and satisfy customer demand. Esie will be thankful if her request loan is approved.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as cases of soft drinks, canned goods, cooking oil and rice to sell

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en: Manuel makes a living through his retail business. He runs a shop in Oroquieta and earns a promising income to support his family. He has signed up for his membership with PMPC to gain access to capital. He wants to increase his inventory. Now, he has availed himself of a loan to purchase plastic kitchen items to sell. Manuel hopes to sustain his business and dreams of sending all his children to school.

loans.use: to purchase plastic kitchen items to sell

loans.name: Albina

texts.en: Albina owns and operates a business growing coconuts on her farm. Albina has been engaged in farming for many years and earns well from this business. Her farm is still doing well and yet she needs financial assistance to improve it. Recently, she took out a new loan from GDMPC micro to pay for farm fertilization. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the farm to improve her general living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for farm fertilization

loans.name: Ardiana

texts.en:
Adriana is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Adriana is 59 years old and has children who are in school.

Adriana has a selling stone crafts business in the Philippines. Adriana requested a 15,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy additional stone crafts to sell.

Adriana has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Adriana would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stone crafts to sell

loans.name: Lourdie

texts.en:
Mark Anthony is 18 years old, single and the son of Lourdie and is the first of three children in the family. His mother Lourdie is a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon and has a general store business.

Lourdie is borrowing PHP 7,500 to pay for tuition fees for her son Mark for the school year 2014-2015/1st semester.

Mark Anthony is currently in the third year of the 4 year Bachelor of Science in Hospitality Management course.

When he graduates, Mark Anthony plans to look for a job help his parents.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Chandara's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer from Preah Vihear province where the electricity supply is in need, Chandara is 41 years old and a married mother blessed with three kids, one of whom is in school. She manages the needs in her household via rice cropping and an animal raising business. She has been involved in her current business for five years, earning about 20,000 KHR per day.  

This is the first loan for Chandara and her group, consisting of five borrowers with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner). As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy solar lighting for her household. She hopes that she will have sufficient electricity to use.

loans.use: To buy solar lighting for her household.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect to Haiti's first solar hybrid smart electricity grid.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect his home to Haiti's first solar hybrid smart electricity grid.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect her home to Haiti's first solar hybrid smart electricity grid.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect to Haiti's first solar hybrid smart electricity grid.

loans.name: Samann

texts.en:
A resident from a rural village of the Bati district, Samann is a 38-year-old mother of four children. The main source of her family’s income is from rice farming. To add more income, she has been working for others for a fee. With her current business, she can earn about US$9 per day to spend for daily expenses.
 
This is the fourth loan for Samann with VisionFund. Now she is applying for a new loan to buy cows to raise in order to better support her agribusiness. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy cows to raise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect to Haiti's first solar hybrid smart electricity grid.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect to Haiti's first solar hybrid smart electricity grid.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect to Haiti's first solar hybrid smart electricity grid.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect to Haiti's first solar hybrid smart electricity grid.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect to Haiti's first solar hybrid smart electricity grid.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en: This loan helps Joel get connected to his local prepay micro-grid. Joel is a preacher and lives with his wife and his four kids in the town of Les Anglais in southern Haiti. Their green and brown house has no reliable access to electricity and thus, Joel is forced to use costly and harmful kerosene for lighting. With three of his kids still in school, he wishes they had better light for studying at night. A solar-powered micro-grid is being installed in Les Anglais, giving Joel and his family the opportunity to connect to a higher quality, lower-cost energy source. He is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to cover the upfront cost of connection to the grid, which he will repay through his payments for electricity. An electrical connection dramatically reduces the cost of lighting in towns such as Les Anglais while offering far superior light quality and more generally providing opportunities for people to dramatically improve their quality of life. To see a video of Les Anglais and the hybrid solar grid, please click here.

loans.use: to connect to Haiti's first solar hybrid smart electricity grid.

loans.name: Danladi

texts.en: Danladi is a Babban Gona farmer. Danladi is driven by one goal; to “ensure other members of my community are lifted out of poverty.” It is this ambition that led Danladi to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Danladi can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Danladi, is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 35 bags per hectare this season because with this loan, he will finally be able to access required yield enhancing inputs, such as improved seeds. Danladi is hoping that as a result of this expected yield, he will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what changes he would like to make, he said “I plan to use the money I make to provide more food and clothing for my family. With this loan, Danladi will be able to access all the inputs and services to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Ayuba

texts.en: Ayuba is a 30-year-old farmer from Ang/Lado.  As a Babban Gona member, Ayuba, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Ayuba can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Ayuba is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, he will be able to acces quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will  result in a yield of at least 35 bags of maize per hectare this season.  Ayuba is hopeful about what the future holds; he  hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, he will finally be able to afford to educate his children; Jenefa,  and  Yusha,. Ayuba’s dreams do not end here: “ultimately, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”, he expressed.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: 09 Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Châm operates a food stall selling vegetables. She has been involved in this business for five years. She is requesting a loan to purchase more vegetables to resell.

Châm is 56 years old and she is married with two children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents.

Châm is the group leader of the 09 Đông Sơn solidarity group, which consists of six members.

In 2008, Châm joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid seven loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Châm faces in her business is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Châm hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to resell
